Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Charm with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: This property has a certain old-world elegance. Check-in was quick in the wood-toned lobby area. Despite a heat-wave in mid-March, the famous rooftop bar was not open yet. The hallways were decorated with Paris scenery and dark hues. Room size was good by Paris standards and the renovations were quite clever in their use of space, especially in the bathroom area. The colour theme was red, bordering on “bordello light”. The double-bed was two singles pushed together and was very hard. I requested extra pillows but still woke up with a crick in my neck (but there was a pillow menu, so I could have ordered a harder pillow). The flat-screen TV in our room did not work and the service man was unable to fix it so we had to move rooms. It was a very quick process and our second room was identical to the first, just two floors up. Both rooms were very warm as the air-conditioning had not been turned on yet. Despite having to open the windows, it was relatively quiet. The bathroom was at the end of the room behind two sets of curtains. It contained a huge tub and separate shower cubicle and tiny toilet cubicle. Shower strength was poor to average and for someone 5’ 10 ½, it was quite claustrophobic. However, the bathroom area did contain two sinks, which is very handy for couples. Amenities were those annoying green/friendly pouches. The closet contained bathrobes, slippers, iron and even an umbrella. The hotel left lovely French sweets on the pillows and the room had lots of nice touches. The breakfast area / restaurant was very calm and was a mixture of older, wealthy couples on holiday and French businessman conducting power breakfasts. The service was a little slow, but the food quality overall was good (although was partner was disappointed with the quality of the sausages). I personally prefer more modern hotels, but my partner leans towards old-world charm. By North American standards 3 ½ stars. This nice property was much more expensive than our other Paris hotel, but then it is like comparing apples and oranges.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & view!”
Reviews.Author: Patsy2652
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcoming staff. Opulent reception and bar area. Lovely room with excellent seating area and tea and coffee making facilities. Good breakfast provided in restaurant, but the restaurant was not open for any other meals. However there are plenty of places to eat and drink within strolling distance. Perfect views across Paris to the Eiffel Tower from our room. Not stayed in Montmartre area before but will return, and hopefully to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Large Prices....and a mouse (x2)”
Reviews.Author: ordflyer
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at Terrass for three days and now looking at the other reviews, I have to wonder if I was at the same hotel. It is not often that I say “never again” but Terrass is one of those places where I won’t be back. This is as close to a "one" star as I have been with a hotel. If you are still interested in staying at Terrass, the least expensive way to get there from CDG airport is via the RER B line, connecting to the number 2 Metro line and exiting at Blanche station which is a short 5 minute walk to the hotel. This will run you €9.75 one way which is about 20-25% of the cost of a taxi from CDG. The rooms are quite small, and the bathroom is very small. The “double” bed was two twin beds pushed together with a gap in between the two beds. My room had light that was coming in through the drapes, it wasn’t until night two that I realized that there was a set of external shutters that could be lowered to block the light. The room I was given was the room that one of my co-workers had the day before. He moved out since there was a mouse or equivalent that was running up and down across the ceiling in this room. He demanded a new room, and was given a new room. Sadly, the management gave me his old room, not realizing that we knew each other. This, I came to realize, is the level of service that one can expect at Terrass. In addition to the mouse in the room, the small bar in the lobby with a fireplace also had a mouse dash across the carpet. We don’t know if it came from my room or not….and I won’t be going back to find out! The conference rooms were extremely cold, resulting in a number of space heaters brought in to try and fix the problem….the rooms on the other hand, were quite hot. Food left a LOT to be desired, and I would never voluntarily eat at the hotel itself. Thank goodness it is on a street with lots of shops and restaurants, and conveniently located across from the hotel is a pizza parlor which will saved several of us during our visit. Don’t bother with room service at night since there apparently are only two items that you can order…there was quite a discussion among us as to whether there was a functioning kitchen at the hotel. Service levels in general are quite low, the bartender claims to be doing both bar service and room service which “might” explain why the bartender is sometimes hard to find. If you are looking for a gym, try a different hotel. On the surface, this is not as bad as a hotel as our experience, but given the cumulative bad things, overall service, two mice and lack of good quality food, combined with high prices I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone. And, this comes from someone who has previously written about the fact that finding a good reasonably priced hotel in Paris is a difficult thing to do. Save your money, save yourself some grief and stay away from Terrass.

Reviews.Title: “Terrass hotel, Paris”
Reviews.Author: mugsyNashville_TN
Reviews.Content: This December was our third trip to Paris. Always tough to compare but all six of us in my family think we would return to the Terrass hotel and to the MOntmartre area. We liked the location of the hotel, the ease of catching the bus,the neighborhood with little stores, shops and bistros, the wonderful desk help, comfortable rooms,free wifi and a very nice breakfast. We booked three rooms and we were on two different floors (adult children) and 3 different style rooms but all were nice. This is not a luxurious four seasons type of hotel, it is a boutique but with a fast elevator and good front desk help. We are not wealthy but love to travel so finding something that is nice but reasonably priced is part of our goal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab views, difficult staff”
Reviews.Author: dimples09
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here over New Years and had a largely positive experience. The hotel is perfectly located if you like the bohemian feel of Montmarte. The Sacre Coeur is nearby and the front facing rooms offer views of the Eiffel Tour (and Montmarte Cemetary!). The room was comfortable and beautifully decorated, if a little on the small side (presumably a Parisian trait). The nearest metro station is a 7-10 minute walk and there's a public bike depot right outside the front door (you can almost freewheel down to the banks of the Seine if that's your thing, although I wouldn't recommend the uphill cycle back). We visited the Moulin de la Galette on New Year's eve and the restaurant is short walk away. Unfortunately, we didn't find the staff particularly friendly. Any time we sought advice, we were generally treated dismissively and a little rudely. Also, when checking-in, we were led to believe that breakfast was included. It wasn't. Rookie mistake, I know, but it left a sour taste (make sure to check your booking!). I was also disappointed to learn that the terrace bar (that the hotel is named for) was closed during the winter, the ground floor bar was a poor substitute.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasurable stay, would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart N
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in two hotels during our visit to Paris recently. Both of which were 4 star hotels. The Terrass Hotel exceeded all of my expectations and we thoroughly enjoyed our very comfortable stay. The hotels location with the room's views along with friendly staff made the other hotel we stayed in look shabby and just did not compare. We couldn't find any faults with our stay. We will be returning in the future

Reviews.Title: “A great location but certainly expensive at the price”
Reviews.Author: theworldisamazing
Reviews.Content: With a city as diverse as Paris its hard to know where to base oneslef but having stayed in other arrondissments it seems a fun idea to try the Sacre-Coeur area on this occasion. The location I would happily recommend but the hotel for the price leaves much to be desired even taking account that we were fortunate enough to have an Eiffel Tower view. The pillows were without doubt the worst I have ever encountered in a hotel, it may sound ungrateful but think about feeling your foam pillow deteriorating under your head as you try to sleep!! We tried to order room service at 9 pm to be told only smoked salmon or foie gras were available..I like both but the lack of choice in a 4 star hotel beggars belief..still the night before we tried to order a drink from room service but were told come down and look for ourselves rather than ask the lady what coffee type liquers they had....to simplify for the money and a four star rating I would be expecting a lot more and a bit of service. Would by the way recommend the 'La Mascotte' restaurant round the corner in Rue de Abbesses...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - awesome views of Paris”
Reviews.Author: FP-MSP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located and has a stunning view from the top floor terrasse. The junior suite has a beautiful eiffel tower view and is very quiet considering the busy road running close to the hotel. The suite is very spacious, the bedding is excellent, so is the "rain" shower with a double sink and a bathtub. The front desk service showed to lack efficiency when handling several tasks at the same time. The breakfast is expensive and too classic. We found our hotel room not cleaned when we came back at 5pm: big drawback for this kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the 18th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: Blackpearl99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to Sacre Coeur and some streets with a lot of good restaurants. The room was rather small but clean and nice. The bathroom rather big (compared to the room) and functional. Price is ok for Paris but not cheap. Breakfast buffet was included and nice. Wifi was included too and pretty fast.

Reviews.Title: “We made the most of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: RMPS01
Reviews.Content: For my birthday my boyfriend took me to paris for the first time. He wanted it to be really special and romantic for me so he booked a junior suite at this hotel and asked for roses to be put on the bed as a surprise and requested a nice room, red if possible to look romantic and offered to pay whatever was neccessary extra. We were so excited to see the room as we'd heard such great things. Check in was meant to be at 2 pm so we walked around Paris to pass the time. We then went to the hotel just after 2 pm and went to check in. The person at the desk told us our room won't be ready till 3pm so we should come back. He didnt apologize for the delay or offer us a drink he just said its not ready and should be ready at 3. Oh but he also said our junior suite had been upgraded to an executive suite which cheered us up a bit. We were so disappointed and had just wanted to go up and relax after just arriving in paris and walking around all morning. As we were leaving I went outside and my boyfriend ran back to confirm that the flowers would be put on the bed as a surprise for me as he requested and the desk clerk confirmed this. So we went out for a while and came back at three. The room was still not ready. We waited a while longer and heard nothing. Then the staff switched and growing impatient as it was nearly 4pm my boyfriend asked if our room was ready. The new desk clerk gave us our key straight away and then we asked for our luggage. We expected them to bring it up but they just gave it to us and went back to work. Not very professional considering how good the hotels meant to be. They should have offered to show us to our room. When we opened the door to the room i was sooooo dissapointed and so was my boyfriend. Not only were the flowers not there, but the room was ORANGE. I hate orange and it was all over the room the walls were covered in orange the bed spread and all the decorations. It was awful. My boyfriend was so upset that there were no flowers to make it romantic. Also, despite them bragging about the eiffel tower view from the window what was worse was the view of the graveyard which was much closer than the eiffel tower literally just below us. We asked if they had another room available in another colour and they said no and when my boyfriend asked aobut the flowers they said there was a mistake and there were none. They also said if we wanted to switch rooms we need to downgrade to a junior suite and they said it so rudely and kept saying we upgraded you to an executive suite as if to say we should be grateful and not complain about anything. I would have been happy if things had gone to plan. Since the call about the orange room the staff were very rude and didn't help us with anything. I would not stay at the hotel again and think that they really ought to change the colour scheme in some of the rooms and try and be a bit more courteous and respectful to guests. The room was clean but nothing special the bathroom was also plain and nothing special. Needs to be made a little more luxiourious if their going to call it an executive suite. Also the area is just near the moulin rouge which is surrounded by sex shops so probably not the best area if your travelling with small children...

Reviews.Title: “Very good address in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: JC_Jubin_11
Reviews.Content: "So French.... americans would love it ! Location is great as long as you want to stay in Montmartre. Good service... for France. All rooms are different. Bar on the roof terrasse with maginificant view is well know in the area and can be booked up. (in summer of course...) I have tryed several rooms and they were all nicelly decorated... XIX century French style so do not expect zen design and cutting edge technology appliances... Never had breakfast there as they are so many cafes in rue des ABesses up the road. "Not cheap.. reasonnable though...

Reviews.Title: “Not again ... !!!!”
Reviews.Author: RL01
Reviews.Content: Come to Paris often and have stayed at different rooms t this hotel. I've had very small room with a even smaller shower, the one that one wall s all mirror ?!?!, suites with view and this last one....2 twin beds with a view of the famous back of the hotel where all windows need to be closed at night or you become the live show. Last friday night I complained about the loudness of rap music coming from a guest room and the gentleman downstairs answered me bout the background music they have on the floors - talk about frustration. I also had to complained about next door room which had a couple that watched tv at 2-300am but very loud and would wake me up. They said they would mention but.....nothing done. Well,my stay was not the most pleasant this time and I regret to inform, it was my let one here. Unfortunately I will be using. Different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and comfortable in Monmartre”
Reviews.Author: PeteUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be in Paris for a night and lucky that this hotel was a good choice having never used it before. On entry it has a charm and decor that immediately calms any nerves about the standard of the rooms or the service. Front desk was charm personified and my room, in the words of the immortal bard, was a cracker with a bathroom and seperate toilet hosting good quality toiletries and plenty of towels all immaculately clean. One word of dissent it boasted only an 'over the bath shower' where the water emerged like from a 90 year old with an enlarged prostate. That said I really liked this hotel, breakfast was good and wholesome plenty of choice and the ability to sit and watch Paris go to work through the windows (not literally). It was in a good location, plenty of brasseries and restaurants for an evening meal - all in all good choice for a few nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ossie2
Reviews.Content: Terrass is the perfect hotel in the Montmarte district, just a few minutes walk from the Metro. As we were a family of 3 we took a junior suite, which was very spaceous and clean. The hotel has alot of charm, but the rooms have been tastefully modernized. The breakfast buffet was excellent (except my son was not happy with his hot chocolate) and the staff were very friendly. We would definitely return to this hotel if we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....”
Reviews.Author: MusicFlyer
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here a few weeks ago (early oct) and must say it was a nice hotel....by french or euro standards. If you are am American, be ready for a really small room, tiny shower, tiny everything. Here is the good reason to stay here: it is right in the heart of montmarte. The finest croissants in the world. I am not kidding. Also incredible fresh oysters and sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Messyhair99
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to be upgraded to a junior suite which had a fine view of the tower. The concierge was very helpful and recommended a great restaurant nearby. The bus was close and handy. Only problem was breakfast which the waiter indicated our room was on the list (which we thought meant included). It wasn't and was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when working from the Paris office”
Reviews.Author: bermondsey_traveller
Reviews.Content: The headquarters of my employer is a short distance from here and the Terrass is best and most convenient place to stay in an area that is dominated by major chain hotels. Service - the staff has a reputation for getting to know its regular clientele and are always friendly Value - comparable in price to the large, corporate hotels but I prefer Terrass than standard issue soul-less places. If I were looking for a weekend in Paris I think I'd expect my money to go a little further however Sleep quality - I've never been kept awake and it's always been quiet Cleanliness - no issue here Location - great square with some lovely restaurants next door. Perfect for Montmartre but a little stretch from the river and the traditional tourist centre so you might find something better closer to Opera for the same price if that's what you're looking for Rooms - Paris pokey. Make sure you don't get landed with a single at the back of the hotel - they are akin to sitting in a coffin but the ones at the front are perfectly fine Restaurant - the terrace is well worth a visit if you are here when it is open and if the weather is good. The restaurant on the ground floor is good but if I were you I'd walk around the corner and choose one of the places on the square

Reviews.Title: “SUPER HOTEL NO TERRASS”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower-Gerbra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful hotell for 3 nights. It's location is perfect. You have the street full of restaurants and small beautiful shops just a step out of the hotel. A ten minutes nice walk up to beautiful Sacrecæur. The room was beautiful decorated, and the breakfast was really lovely. The only thing that we really missed doing was to have a chance to stay on the terrass. The staff told us that it was the restaurant that decided when the terrass should be open, and of course the weather. So we didn't understand why the terrass was closed when the sun was shining and there was no wind. But overall I would recomand this hotel, and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend success”
Reviews.Author: Niklas1max2
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris more times than I can remember and have stayed in many great,chic or .." inexpensive" hotels ( my earlier years?) and have never had the chance to truly explore Montmartre. The hotel concierge is truly helpful and will help...not just send you to his mates restaurant! The room we had was beautifully appointed,clean and two large sinks in bathroom ( still only enough room for just my wife's stuff on the counter?). We tried to get a view ,but that was going to be €150 per night more? And we have seen the view many times before! Better to spend it on dinners. We were there the second weekend in September 2011, busy time in Paris! When we walked to the horrendously crowded Marais, St Michael, etc ,we realised how great it was to be staying in relatively quiet Montmartre. A great hotel to stay in to discover a different part of Paris,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrahamClark
Reviews.Content: We found the Terrass Hotel to be clean and comfortable. We paid 325 Euros for two nights and felt this was very good value. The room was spacious, clean and well decorated. The hotel was well placed for exploring Montmatre. All the staff we dealt with were polite and efficient. There was no view from the room but this was more than made up for by the wonderful view from the 7th floor terrace. The terrace bar was a bit pricey but not that much more expensive than the general Paris prices. If you want a good meal out at a cheaper cost the Le Basilic restaurant is 50 yards away with a fixed price menu for 23 euros. We had an enjoyable stay at the hotel and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Marcus1983Zurich
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely weekend here with my partner and my mother in September 2011. The rooms we had were very nice and clean with a wonderful view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and very friendly, especially the lady working in reception who was about to start learning Russian - I wish her luck with this. The location is perfect for the lovely areas of Montmartre and Abesses. The Terrass Hotel is certainly much more preferable to other hotels which are closer to the centre, in a more crowded area, and are certainly not as nice as this hotel. I would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, but certainly not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Critter_Lovers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Terrass Hotel for a business meeting for a few days in June. My comments are mostly positive but there are some negative, the location was great, easy walking distance to the Metro or bus service. The view from the roof top deck was that best feature of the hotel. The rooms were fairly small but overall I found it to be adequate. I had a room facing an internior courtyard, no view but quieter than the rooms facing the street. Not having traveled to Paris before, I could not compare to other hotels. Great neighborhood for walking. There are a huge number of good cafes within a short walking distance of the hotel. I would recommend not eating at the roof top deck or hotel restaurant, the prices were very high and the food was nothing exceptional, better to go to one of the local restaurants where the food and service was better and prices much more reasonable. The concierge recommended some local restaurants that turned out to have very good food and did not try to steer us to the hotel restaurant. I had no issues with the staff and was always treated in a courteous manner.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great terrace”
Reviews.Author: lindyh
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights here and had a great time. Room was very clean and comfortable and good to find a hotel with rooms set aside for smokers. We had a view looking over Paris. Soundproofing is very good as despite being almost opposite the lift we hardly heard other guests at all. Bed and seating were very comfortable. Location is great with easy access to the Metro and lots of nice shops and restaurants in the local area. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as thought it sounded expensive and just used a local restaurant instead. Reception/concierge and bar staff were very helpful and most spoke excellent English. Terrace is amazing, yes, it gets very busy, especially with non residents and yes, the drinks are expensive but we thought it worth it for a nightcap each night. All in all a nice relaxing place for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but not my kind of hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel because is in the area of Place du Clichy, where I normally stay as it is lively and convenient for my business needs. The hotel seems to advertise itself for the views (and balconies, hence Terrass), but I got a room on the second floor overlooking a narros and dark internal courtyard. The room itself was really small and overheated, as I could not find a thermostat, I had to sleep with the window open despite being really cold outside. The receptionists were really nice and helpful, trying to sort us out with the moody Parisian taxi drivers. The breakfast was also of really good quality, probably above the average standard I have experienced for this city. But nevertheless, the and a bit tired forniture, broken tiles in the bathroom, and generally overdecorated environment is really not my style. I prefer new and functional places. It might have less "character", but when I am in Paris, I stay at the Mecure 100 meters down the road, as it ticks more of my boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but ?”
Reviews.Author: Super010
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is lovely, our room was lovely and we could not complain about the accomodation at all. However the Hotel does not appear to want to do food in the evening. The Terrace Bar was really nice but very small, and is advertised on a sign board in the street. So as residents we were unable to dine there as the Terrace Bar was full of people who were there for a drink and social chat, a brilliant view and great atmosphere but not somewhere to go for a nice meal. If you did wish to dine in the Hotel then there was no option, the main restuarant was closed and the Terrace Bar was full. Even later in the evening when we went up for a drink we could not get in, it is so small. Waiting in the foyer for a taxi on our last evening we watched many people come in, ask how to get to the Terrace, go up in the lift, and then come back down and out within 5 minutes. This Hotel is lovely, brilliant location, great atmosphere and shops in the area, and loads of lovely restaurants, and this Hotel clearly expects you will dine out in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “A rudderless ship crewed by disinterested Parisiennes”
Reviews.Author: J_Homer_11
Reviews.Content: We found the staff on the desk uninterested in us and emailed requests ahead of our stay where ignored even though they were asked for by the hotel. The room was dated and the soundproofing exceptionally poor. The staff in the breakfast area (restaurant otherwise closed as was the terrace) were very attentive as if from another organisation. The view was however fantastic and with the appointment of effective management it could become a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time we came, next time we come again”
Reviews.Author: WVE
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We've stayed there already 3 times over the last 10 years. Next time we'll stay again. The staff is friendly and the ambience in the hotel is classy and classic. The hotel has nice french styled rooms, not very big but well equiped and clean. The location is great, just a few minutes walk from Mont Martre, Moulin Rouge etc. In a street where Paris lives and you do not only see tourists. Lsots of little restaurants and gourmet shops.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: Theatremanager
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been recommended by friends and it certainly lived up to all expectations. The room was very well presented, the staff polite and extremely helpful. We went to the terrace bar on the second night of our stay. The view is amazing, you can see all across. We had supper here too, although not cheap, but delicious all the same! In fact we enjoyed it so much we returned for our final night. The waiter gave us a table looking straight at the Eiffel Tower and even took a photo of us on his phone and emailed it to me! Do visit this wonderful hotel, the surrounding area is delightful, full of history, in a beautiful city. We are definately returning!

Reviews.Title: “A Montmartre gem - lovely rooms and so near to everything”
Reviews.Author: Fluffychuffy
Reviews.Content: The Terrass is the only 4* hotel in Montmartre I think and a very nice one it is too. It is a 5 min walk to 2 metros (Blanche and Place de Clichy) and is about 10 mins from Gare Du nord so if you come on Eurostar it could not be easier. The rooms ( we had a deluxe) are lovely - very clean and spacious - we had a Hammam (Turkish Steam shower) in ours and it was great every day coming back to have one of them. There are slippers and robes in the room and a minibar and the beds are so comfy, we slept like logs. The Bar on the top floor is outside and a lovely plave to have a drink before or after dinner - we didnt eat there but the food looked very good.It is so near to thelovely streets of restaurants and shops in Montmartre - you literally leave the hotel and the main street of Rue Le Pic is on your doorstep with great clothes shops, bakeries, cafes and restaurants all nearby. Some tips: Try the macaroons at the bakery on Rue LePic, we went to Mon Oncle(Rue Durantin) for dinner which was delicious - proper French bistro, Le Coquelicot des Abbesses is great for brekkie and in Abbesses (5 min walk) is a lovely open area with a small market and some lovely cafes for people watching . All in all a great hotel to be in and a perfect one for going out!

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent stay at the Terrass!”
Reviews.Author: widowwebb
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Terrass Hotel. We had a triple size room and it was huge! I wasn't sure what to expect after reading reviews about tiny Paris rooms, so this was a pleasant surprise. The decor was modern and very nice. The bathroom was also huge! Our room didn't have a tub, but that shower was so large--plenty of room for shaving, etc. I found the staff to be extremely polite, friendly, and helpful!!! I was a little nervous after reading the reviews, but I found the staff to be pleasant. Our room had wi fi and we never had any trouble accessing the internet at all. We did not have the breakfast at the Terrass Hotel because it seemed a little expensive. As much as I hate to do this--we had breakfast at Starbucks almost every morning, because it was so cheap in comparison to many breakfasts in the area. The neighborhood is wonderful! There are so many restaurants, bakeries, ice cream, etc. all within short walking distance. There are also two or three different metro lines all within walking distance--not far at all--even with a 4 year old.

Reviews.Title: “a very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: pensivegirl
Reviews.Content: we just finished a 11 night stay at this hotel. as soon as we checked in, some of the staff were very rude and had no time for customers like us who were spending 300 euros per night. the first thing the front desk guy tried to do was tell us that we had the lowest type of room they offer and that we should upgrade. i explained that we did not want to spend more than the $320 per night and that we knew what we had booked and thank you. instead of being nice about it, he still tried to tell us that we would be much happier in a larger room. when you get to your room, you will find a hotel manual. you will also find that it is purposefully vague. it explains that the concierge is there to help you make reservations etc. it also tells you how to use the phone in your room. don't be surprised, though, when you are charged to make LOCAL calls and when the concierge charges 15 euros per person to make a single reservation. ridiculous. we were kept up two nights in a row by what sounded like drilling above our heads. when we called down in the morning to speak to the front desk about the noise, they said they would look into it. come to find out, the person above us had fallen asleep with the jaccuzie running. and all night long - for two nights, it was making this horrible, terrible noise. we were obviously upset and very tired from our lack of sleep and we didn't even get an "i'm sorry" from the staff member. funny, because last i heard, in customer service, saying "i'm sorry" goes a long way. we booked our stay through hotels.com and paid in advance. when we checked out, we were told we had not paid for one of the nights we stayed. we didn't want to miss our flight and didn't have time to look into whether or not this was true, so we paid them an additional $320. come to find out, we had paid for that night, and we are still trying to resolve this issue. there were a few members of the staff that were great. but the rest were terribly below adequate. and the room service breakfast? $25 per person. for bread, coffee and juice. i understand acting like a 4 star hotel, but give me a break.

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay at Terrrass again”
Reviews.Author: FromBaltimore
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Paris to visit my daughter who is studying there for a semester, I stayed at Terrass because of location was convenient to where my daughter is living. Although I have been to Paris a number of times, I have always stayed on the Left Bank. I was delighted with my stay at Terrass in every way every way. The room was clean and comfortale, the staff could not have been more courteous or helpful, the location proved to be wonderful, and the bonus was the open air rooftop bar and restaurant from which there is an incredible view of both the Eifel Tower and Invalides. Yes, I could, particularly on weekends, hear music at night, but one can hardly complain about this when staying in Mamartre. All in all, I wish our back and Paris and if I were I would be staying at Terrass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sulla27
Reviews.Content: I stay in lots of hotels for work and I would call this a proper 4 star hotel in a nice part of Monmartre just far away from the ultra touristy parts and next to a load of great bistros and cafes. Being in Paris this means that it is very far from cheap, but you can have sensible conversations about the usual things, rooms, transfers, bookings for shows etc etc. We had a great time, enjoyed the views from both our room (don't expect a room with a view unless you have deep pockets) and from the just opened Terrass Bar, where they went out of their way to get us a decent table on a Saturday night. Breakfast is very good but from the ground floor restaurant. Great staff, nice hotel, great position

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Roof Top Bar”
Reviews.Author: cbland15
Reviews.Content: We stayed mid April as a group of 3 couples. We stayed in rooms 211, 214 and 215. The rooms were all different in decor and facilities. This is not one of those chain hotels where every thing is the same. Check-in was very friendly and efficient. The rooms were good sized with good facilities. Breakfast was typical in the sense that it was a buffet style. However, the food was good. We all really liked the fresh orange juice. On the 7th floor there is a roof top bar that also serves snacks. This was expensive but the views over Paris towards the Eiffel Tour were to die for. There are big umbrellas and patio heaters. The hotel is located close to the Paris Metro. We used Blanch station. It is not too far to walk to Sacre Coeur. There is a good selection of bars, cafes and resteraunts nearby. This hotel and staff deserve a top rating.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: barneymc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Its about 5 minutes from the metro, on a street Rue Abbess with lots of activity. There is a great selection of local bars, cafés, restaurants and general shops - on a Saturday the place is really vibrant. It's near to Montmatre, so we walked up there also. Less than 10 minutes away you'll find larger supermarkets should you need do buy some essentials at very reasonable prices. The hotel itself was very clean, the room well laid out. Yes the room is small, but this is Paris - you aren't going to be spending hours in your bedroom are you? It is a 4* hotel and does deserve each star. Funky modern décor in the room and bathroom - large double shower was great too:-). No hesitation in recommending it. You can get breakfasts in one of the many cafés nearby. When booking we asked for a room with a view rather than the courtyard...we got the Eiffel Tower in the distance (ok the cemetary was directly below but you cant have everything....)

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations......”
Reviews.Author: JSP&KMP
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris on many occasions and having stayed in Montmartre 5 times, I had long had my eye on this hotel. Having got both children through Uni could now afford it! We were warmly welcomed and our room although small was immaculate and comfortable. Staff were all friendly and courteous. We didn't bother with breakfast at 22 Euros but instead found an Atrisan bakers Gerrard Cherrier (I think) just round the corner on Rue Caulincort which did excellent coffee and amazing breads. Also Le Cafe Qui Parle just next to the bakers does an excellent breakfast for 6.50. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again at The Terrass. Only downside was the Happy Hour in the bar, lovely atmosphere, pianist tinkling and great barman but we were charged full price for our drinks, which at 14Euros per cocktail were steep, not quite sure what Happy Hour was about but certainly not reduced prices!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff in odd location”
Reviews.Author: bornsenile
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Terrass hotel for our summer break in 2010 and were disappointed with the overall experience. We had boked through the internet and paid a premium, thinking it would be well located near the Sacre Couer. While this was the case, the hotel itself was disappointing. The first room we were given overlooked a cemetry, and the air conditioning did not work. The hotel staff were not helpful in either changing or repairing that. We finally changed to another room, but this was directly under the rooftop restaurant and very noisy as a consquence. We did spend most of the 5 days we were there outside the hotel exploring the city, but the nights were not restful. Would not recmmend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Propably one of the best hotels in Monmartre”
Reviews.Author: kblounas
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights. Staff was very friendly and helpful in everything i asked for. All things were set up for the nice and easy stay of the customer. Access is easy from Abbesses metro station and Blanche station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: RichardWilsonUK
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. After many trips to Paris staying in everything from 5 star to 2 star hotels, this was a real find for us and we will definitely return. Coming into the Gare du Nord on Eurostar, the location is easy to get to. We had booked well ahead and had a classic double room on the front of the hotel on the fourth floor looking across Paris to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel itself is on a hill and there are both classic and deluxe rooms on the front so it is not necessary to pay a deluxe premium for a view. If a little smaller than a deluxe, the room was otherwise perfect. Clean and modern decoration, comfy bed, and well appointed bathroom. Breakfast was lovely, service was friendly and helpful, and the area of Montmartre is full of boutique shops and restaurants to visit. Just one small note: do not arrive too late for breakfast if you want a full choice of hot items.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet”
Reviews.Author: JMcoupleinc
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience was very good. We would like to make special mention of the staff on the Sunday Morning and the barman on Saturday Night for the weekend just gone, without thier hospitality we would have had a much different experience. To elaborate, on our arrival on the saturday, well before checkin as we wanted to dump our bags and go exploring, I don't think this was well received from the receeption staff as thier tone was kind of unfriendly and short, it could have been that we weren't fluent french speaking but we did attempt to speak french as much as possible. After a long day of exploration we found our room to be well presented, small but adequate and very typical for hotel rooms in Paris. The mattress was great and the selection of pillows made a difference (as the pillow supplied is too flimsy). We loved exploring the area of Montemarte and had an awesome dining experience at a local restaraunt and then decided before retiring a drink in the hotel bar which had a cosy atmosphere and the barman was also very attnetive and friendly. Our sleep was sound except for some slight street noise (the shutters helped) but generally quiet. As mentioned above the staff on the desk in the morning were great and we left with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TigEngland
Reviews.Content: Stunning Hotel set in a fantastic location!!! Ignore the reviews that say the location is too far out, as there are a number of Metro stops nearby all within walking distance. It’s ideal if you are planning to go and see the Moulin Rouge as it is only one street away with great restaurants(if you love good food you must eat at the Moulin la Gazette, simply stunning!) and bars close by, and away from the hustle and bustle of Central Paris. Area is a haven for locals and is reflected in the service. Hotel has an excellent bar area(however is pricy!) and all the staff make you feel very welcome. The rooms are an adequate size and are immaculate with flat screen TV and mini bar. Bathrooms are excellent very comfortable and clean. The Hotel has a highly recommended restaurant, however we did not eat there, but fully intend too next time we return! If you do not have breakfast included in your price, the cost is 17 Euros for a continental breakfast which is a little step. There are however plenty of nice bakeries that you can get a pastry from at a reasonable cost all within a 2/3 min walk from the hotel. Overall an gem of a hotel set in a fantastic location, well priced and would thoroughly recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations in Paris”
Reviews.Author: katgut
Reviews.Content: I really like the Terrass Hotel. The lobby is a bit traditional, but the room decor and amenities are modern and superb. The rooms are small (but this is Paris, so they always are). However ours was immaculately decorated, very comfortable, with luxurious bedding and perfect for sleep. The staff was very helpful; the free breakfast was the best we had on this trip. I also really enjoyed the location. Montmartre is a neighborhood where Parisians live and is not as central, but it's very pleasant and perfect if this is not your first time in Paris and you want to feel more like a local than a tourist. Another plus was always being able to get a taxi outside the hotel. Overall I would stay here again and certainly recommend the hotel to friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Close to Sacre Coeur, Easy to get about.”
Reviews.Author: Ziblo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Oct, The Hotel staff are friendly, Got a room with bath when checked in, Came back to reception and asked for a room with shower, I was offered one and told to go and see if I wanted to take it. I did, got a room with shower. No fuss at all. Wanted an ice bucket for the champayne in our room, again no problems. The hotel is clean and very well located. The metro station is Blanche, 5 mins walk to the Hotel going up Rue Lepic then turning left at the top of the road. The hotel is at the bottom of the road. Very easy to get to the centre of Paris, Arc de triomphe, Eiffel tower Champs Elysee etc. We are going back to Paris and will stay at Terass again.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganised and poorly run retaurant for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: alat
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very dissapointed by this hotel as most of the reviews we read beforehand had been excellent. The location is very good and the room was comfortable and well appointed if a bit small and we had one looking inwards so had no view. The staff generally were very helpful but the hotel managers response to my complaints has been less than satisfactory. He's not really listening. They did give us a glass of champagne on the terrace with a lovely view as way of compensation but if we'd paid ourselves it would have cost 31 euros and the restaurant is fully booked so you can't just pop up there ! The problems were primarily with breakfast and the retaurant management and his staff - a joke ! We waited for half an hour for hot food and kept being told it would be ready in 5 mins. No tables were cleared so you sit looking at other customers half eaten food. If you want tea then make sure you ask for breakfast tea as they brought Earl Grey on every occasion. They only provide one or two milk portions in the rooms for tea and coffee so ask for more upfront if you'd like at least two cups each a day. If you like coffee with cold milk make sure you ask as they always bring hot milk and did so on one occasion in a jug with no lid and a broken spout. They also brought us cold milk in a jug that had congealed milk in it and made me feel sick. The poached eggs are cooked in vinegar so tasted very bad. The scrambled eggs were luke warm at best. The bacon is very fatty. The electricity broke down in our room twice and we had to be moved before we had spent one night but had unpacked all our things ! The concierge was very helpful and helped us move and then recommended a restaurant for us to eat in. Don't follow the advice as it was the most expensive restarurant we tried during our 3 night stay 65 euros for two mussels and chips and 3 pints of beer. If you are on a budget but want good food thats cheap we recommend going to Flunch which is part of the castorama complex on the way to the place de clichy metro.We had two roast chicken, chips and veg , one dessert and two glasses of beer and one coffee for 16 euros ( thats for both of us not each !! ) Not a great setting but fills a hole cheaply. We also had a lovely meal over looking the Notre Dame and paid less than the 65 euros we paid on the first night ! Alcohol is very expensive in Paris at at least 7 euros per pint of beer ! The cheapest we found was 1.75 euros in McDonalds. We also experienced the maid coming in to our room without knocking at 8.30am one morning and seeing us in bed so ensure you always put the do not disturb sign up even early !! We were in a room next to the service door and they squeak terribly so every morning we heard squeaks and couldn't sleep. You can also hear other peoples shower and baths as if they are in your room. All in all the hotel wants to do well and looks good from the outside and gives an impression of good quality but the service and our experience was way below a 4 star experience. However all that said it didn't detract from Paris itself which is fantastic and we will definitely go back to Paris but not to the Terrass Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is unsafe and has no regard for customers safety”
Reviews.Author: frankfulco
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris last week to celebrate my daughters 21st birthday. Upon arrival we took a taxi from the airport to the hotel and a I as checking in, I lowered my briefcase adjacent to my feet to fill out the hotel requested paperwork. Within a minute, my briefcase was grabbed and the thieves ran right out the front door. That theft cost me virtually all of my cash, three credits cards, my passport, camera, laptop, frequent traveler cards, phone cards, all my prescriptions, the list goes on. I had just bought the briefcase made of exotic KUDU while in Africa during my world cup visit. The ensuing collateral damage between visits to the police station to fill out police reports (3 hours), US Embassy twice (8 hours) a confrontation with the hotel summoned taxi driver, loss of funds and time had a devasting affect on my planned 5 days to celebrate, sight see and shop for my daughters birthday. Needless to say it did not help that both of the automatic sliding doors (entrance and foyer) were left in the open position, which aided the culprits int heir quick escape. After my episode, the doors were never left open again during my stay, when questioned the staff said they open them periodically to air out the hotel????? Here's where it gets worse, the General Manager, Mehdi [--]was completely unresponsive, I requested multiple times daily to meet and discuss the bad situation in which the theft had left me, especially since I was there to celebrate my daughters birthday and stuck post theft with only one credit card and a few hundred dollars that happened to be in my pocket at the time of the theft. My loss in total was more the $12,000, it's hard to put a price tag on the loss of two days and the interruption of this planned experience with a loved family member for such an important life experience. I made daily requests for the next 5 days to meet the GM - [--] only to be told he was in meeting after meeting and put off each day, as he came and went avoiding my open time requests to meet. I did look at the security footage, and sure enough the two culprits came into the hotel as I was checking in and waited unnoticed for the chance to grab the briefcase. This apparently is not the first time this has happened at this hotel and the area definitely dictates front door security. Previously I had stayed at the Ritz-Carlton and believe me it is well worth the extra money, because a situation like this would have never happened or if it did they would have stepped up and ensured I was handled with care and attention that a tough situation like this one required. Having traveled most of my adult life for work and pleasure, this is the most blatant disregard for the customer I have ever seen, heard or experienced. I own many retail company's and customer service and satisfaction are the corner stones of our success The bottom line is this hotel and its leadership will do nothing for you if you have a problem, and only value your money not you as the customer. The Assistant Manager did agree to pay for my cab ride to the US Embassy the following morning but upon arrival they neglected to tell the cab driver they would pay for my fair. The lack of english skills resulted in me getting into a confrontation upon arrival, as he expected me to pay, could not speak "english" and decided that grabbing my wrist, breaking my watch and ripping my bag was how we would handle me telling him the Hotel was responsible to pay for my ride. To top it off, he then went to the police and they attempted to arrest me upon leaving the embassy. Even this second episode did not allow me the chance to meet with management. They simply said they forgot to tell the taxi driver when I called the hotel from my US phone with the police ready to take me in. Management said we will reimburse you upon return. In all fairness Louis and Daniele did their best to help a bad situation during my stay in their roles of doorman and concierge, however, I would strongly request that you DO NOT stay at this hotel. I have traveled much of the world, stayed at literally thousands of hotels and never in my life have I been so put off and disrespected as I was by the leadership of this hotel. Feel free to email me at [--] if you need any more information to make your decision. I abbreviated my story, but the loss of two days running around without the hotels help cost me a valuable experience with my daughter and one I will never forgive or forget. Frank Fulcoc CEO FMI Corp.

Reviews.Title: “Terrass hotel”
Reviews.Author: lacoca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in montmatre, just 5 walking minutes from the famous Moulin Rouge. (Pigalle). The position is excellent, just over a hill, you can enjoy the best view of the eiffell tower. The are where the hotel is located, is full of small tipical french shops and bars. We appreciated breakfast walking left side of the hotel. Talking about the hotel itself, I consider 3 stars in average, but we choose the junior suite room 802. That is the best choice!!! EXCELLENT!! The room is well provided and offer also a Jacuzzi with view of the eiffell tower! The room has also a private balcony, minibar,TV and very comfortable towels and linen. Reccomendation is spend a little bit more and go for the junior suite, otherwise look for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Celestial Hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: bbradyesq
Reviews.Content: Frequest travels to Paris on business and vacation often bring superb, local boutique hotels to my attention. After several unsuccesfful attempts to stay at the Hotel Terrass in Montmartre, I was finally able to secure a room for 4 nights on a short business trip from June 29th through the 3rd of July. The hotel exceeded all of my expectations, both from a business and pleasure perspective. Each of the comments in reviews about the lovely concierge, Danielle, are "spot on." She graciously assisted in recommending restaurants, giving accurate directions to the Metro, La Moulin de la Galette and Restaurant La Chammarre behind Sacre Coeur, and advising that 'you must see the Musee Nissim de Camondo by the Parc Monceau if you intend upon visiting the Musee Jacquemart-Andre. And the Parc Monceau is the most "Parissienne" of all.!" Armed with brochures she supplied, I metroed about Paris on my only free afternoon. She was right again! When a last minute change in business plans took me back to London for a day, she deftly jumped online, and then decided I'd have a better selection of Eurostar fares and travel class availability by walking a short 2 blocks to the SCNF offices on Rue Lepis two blocks away. She was absolutely correct, and accordingly my client and I saved 200 Euros each on a business premier ticket. The Diapason Terrace Restaurant was also booked several months in advance, but on a Tuesday night at 10 o'clock there is usually room for a single. After sitting at a pub table sipping Pelligrino water and a delicious sauvignon blanc, a table replete with commanding view of the Parisian sky line and Tour Eiffel opened, and I was promptly transferred. Each course was beautifully prepared, and the patient staff directed my French appropriately where needed, and in "Anglais" when a perplexed look crossed my face. My quiet room on the rear "jardin" side of the hotel muted all traffic sounds. I slept peacefully on my very comfortable queen-sized bed each night. If our final celestial reward is as placid and enjoyable as the Hotel Terrass, then I have briefly visited heaven in Paris this summer.

Reviews.Title: “room lovely”
Reviews.Author: sootyboy
Reviews.Content: have just returned from a 4 night break .deluxe room on 1st floor lovely,but facing street so is pretty noisy.air-con much welcomed and worked very well.check-in very very slow,but receptionist very welcoming and helpful.breakfast not very organised,shown to a table on 1st day,no cutlery or milk on table,not a great choice to eat either,thank goodness the price was in the rate we paid. tea ,coffee and biscuits left on 1st day only, had to ask for again and was told that this was normally only left as a welcoming privelige on the 1st night,not great for a 4 star hotel,been in hotels all over the world and this is usually replaced every day.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star. (by the way there are no 5 stars in france. it does not exist...so its funny that the George V is all so 4 star) The reception area is a bit scary. But don't be fooled, the rooms have been renovated. The standard rooms are extremely small...but the junior suite is perfect for a higher price of course. Try and get a room higher up because it less noisy. Beds are good. Internet is fast and the location is just perfect. Breakfast is very nice. Its done by a restaurant so its not your typical hotel breakfast. Forget about early breakfast in your room. Room service only starts when the restaurant opens. Good hotel. Not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: rakibey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, and staff is friendly and professional. Having lived in several Parisian hotels before, I know that the standard is not very good, however I expected more from this hotel. Reception area is ok, but nothing more. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are elegant but old and worn out. Old small television, a bathroom that definately needs an update (lots of scratches etc in the bath tub and the floor felt greasy like it had never been washed, may just be the material, dont know??) and a bed that is not very comfortable. My cleanliness rating is mainly because of the bathroom standard that does not look and feel clean, but it may be. If you are lucky you can get a room with cemetary view - yes, you read right, the neighbour is a cemetary... (and see the Eiffel tower in the background) The hotel restaurant is not worth a visit, food at high prices that is not worth the money... All in all it is OK, but I think you could do better, and the price is definately too high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly service, & wonderful concierge; loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about the friendly, helpful service at Hotel Terrass. The concierge, Danielle, recommended excellent restaurants and, of course, made our reservations. She also gave us helpful advice about traveling around the city, how to avoid the long lines at the Louvre, and which tour to take to get a good overview of the city; we cannot praise her enough! The hotel is well located (you can easily walk to the church of the Sacred Heart (Sacre Coeure) in Montmartre to mix with the numerous artists at the Place du Tertre and see the panoramic view of Paris. Excellent restaurants are nearby, the metro is just up the street from the hotel, and Le Moulin Rouge is just a couple of blocks away. It was a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: H0ney_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my husband to Paris over the Valentines weekend (bit corney I know) but he had never been. I booked the Terras Hotel based on the good reviews I had read on Trip Advisor hoping for nice relaxing weekend taking in a few sights. Upon arrival the poor level of service became very apparent. Check in was very half hearted almost felt i was a bother to the receptionist (a feeling that continued throughout our stay). The room was quite nice, a tad small in size but had everything we needed. Even had a nice BOSE speaker by the bed for the ipod, flat screen tv, in room safe etc. Unfortunately all this was spoilt by the very poor service examples being our room was not turned down once (ok so an attempt was made once at 7am while we were still sleeping), nor the free tea and coffee replenished when requested for again the 'ANYTHING IS TOO MUCH' attitude surfaced, not quite the same 'nothing is too much' attitude they advertise. I called down for a knife from the restaurant and got told to come and get it myself. I called the consierge in the morning to order a cab for the evening, surprise surprise we got downstairs at 7pm to find no record of a cab request. At every request we really felt a bother and annoyance and ended up just doing things ourself or leaving the hotel. This is not what I am used to or expected from such a hotel. There were some good things about this hotel but for me service is a very big part of my stay anywhere so unfortunately it ruined this stay for both my husband and I.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel; Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Min3010
Reviews.Content: Found our stay at Terrass Hotel to be very pleasant. To summarise: Hotel: - Modern and well furnished - Nice reception - Terrass on top floor has great views of Paris Rooms: - Reasonable size for a city hotel - However large bathroom - Didnt have great view from the room but I know there are rooms with views overlooking the city and the eiffel tower Restaurant : - Buffet Breakfast had a reasonable variety however if you go when they open they dont have much prepared and are abit slow to set-up so we were disappointed - Didnt have dinner at the restaurant but it looked quite busy and lively and is of a good size Bar: - Small but cosy Service: - Rooms well cleaned everyday - Reception staff attentative - Friendly staff Location: - very good location - Not in the heart of Paris but the main attractions are easily accessible as the metro is only a five to 10 minute walk - Lots of pubs, bars and restaurants nearby - Pleasant, cobled streets that are not overly busy but still a quite lively with a good atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Tiny Room!”
Reviews.Author: Pontybird
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Montmatre, which is a 5 minute walk from both Blanche & Abbesses Metro stations - although there are about a million steps in the Abbesses as its the deepest Meto station in Paris, so use the Blanche one. There are lovely restaurants and cafe's along the Rue de Abbesses - you get much more value for money if you have an evening meal here. There is a lovely restaurant called the something '...Garcon' which is past the Abbesses station up on the left, the salads are unbelieveable!!!! The roast chicken is amazing too!! Dont bother with the hotel breakfast, it's extortionate, just pop out and pick up a croissant from one of the Boulangeries along the Rue de Clichy or pop into one of the cafes down by the Moulin Rouge. There are 2 Starbucks in Montmatre, one by the Moulin Rouge (opposite Blanche metro) and one on the Place de Clichy, handy if you fancy a coffee whilst you walk. Our room was TINY, considering we were there for 4 nights and the hotel didnt seem particularly full they gave us the smallest room possible...it was at the end of the corridor so avoid these types of rooms if you can, the bathroom had no storage space for you to put your toiletries, I had to keep mine in toiletry bags by the side of my bed. Apart from a large wardrobe there was no-where else to store any of your things in the room, bedside cabinates were just covered tables with no draws. Handy. Staff were pleasant and friendly, no problem communicating, English was was spoken. The bed was quite hard, kept waking up with pins and needles! Make sure you call up and order yourself a couple of the pillows off the 'Pillow menu', the Bamboo one seemed like a good idea but was like sleeping on a thin bit of tissue paper...go for the Goosedown! We enjoyed the walks into the centre of paris, took about 1 hour to stroll to the Louvre, for example. You get to see lots of nice architecture and get a feel for the city whilst walking so would recommend the stroll. This hotel is about 10 mins walk from the Sacre Cour, which is definitely worth a look, there are also liitle restaurants, cafes and squares behind the Scare Cour which are worth a look. The views from here a lovely, particularly on a clear day. There are lots of steps, but if you take your time, its worth walking rather than taking the little tram. We didnt eat at the hotel or order room service, but mini bar was pricey. We took our laptop which was great as the internet connection was fab and free! Room was clean and was made up every day. We got a decent rate for this hotel if we hadn't it wouldn't have been worth the 280 euros per night that they say the room is worth!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: wendydee
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the hotel, with friends, visiting the restaurant on our first night. The food was very good. The hotel was excellent, with the service being exemplary. The decor was tasteful, and facilities even included a brolly to borrow in each room. Nothing had been overlooked. The prices in the restaurant and in the bar were expensive, but once we realised this, we ate out. Breakfast, which was included in our deal, was excellent, with a great variety of choices for all tastes.There are numerous good eating and drinking places within easy walking distance. The hotel was easy for the Pigalle area and Montmartre, all of which are walkable if you have the time and energy. We had a really good time

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: harveypips
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 09 & have to say we had an excellent time. The hotel is very smart, clean & comfortable. The rooms aren't massive but perfectly adequate & furnished to a high standard. All the staff were very polite aswell. We did find the hotel restaurant prices were quite expensive but that seemed to be the case across Paris & we were expecting that. The hotel is about 5-10 min walking distance to the Moulin Rouge & nearby metro station so the whole of Paris is easily accessible. If we came to Paris again we would book the Terrass in an instance.

Reviews.Title: “Three Nights was too short”
Reviews.Author: travelbugz2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Terrass Hotel three nights in the beginning of September and absolutely loved this hotel. We were pretty fortunate to take advantage of a deal on Expedia where our third night was free, otherwise this hotel’s nightly rates were a little out of our original budget. The hotel itself is well located close to several metro stops-Blanche, Place de Clichy, Pigalle, and Abbesses . In the area there are also many restaurants and bakeries to choose from, as well as a Laundromat that we were very pleased to take advantage of. Also good to know is that there is a grocery store near by where you can stock up on essentials like bottled water and snacks. The room itself was well decorated, kept impeccably clean, spacious and the beds very comfortable. We stayed in a room with two single beds. The room was equipped with an in room safe and a kettle which we used quite often to make an afternoon tea from tea we picked up at the nearby supermarket but the hotel supplied the room with a selection as well. Also a great feature of our room was that bathroom had two separate sinks which is helpful when two girls have quite a few toiletries-it was nice to spread our things out! Only thing that may have not been so ideal was the set up of the shower-the shower/ tub was not in an enclosed area and not being used to sitting to take a shower (as there was a cut out in the tub to sit and have your shower) we did find that things left out at the near by sink was in the splash zone and did get wet. All the staff we encountered were friendly and it is always nice to get greeted with a “Bonjour” or “Bonsoir” every time you entered and exited the hotel. Also helpful to us was that every staff member we encountered spoke English very well which is a relief to those of us whose French is not so good. I really liked this hotel-in fact I can’t imagine staying at another hotel on my next visit to Paris (because yes I also loved this city!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money we paid”
Reviews.Author: Dunn
Reviews.Content: A good location – easy to get to from the Eurostar. Staff were helpful on check in – trying to get us a room earlier than they needed to. Room was nicely furnished and comfortable. However TV didn’t work. We weren’t fussed as were only there for 1 night, but you’d think this would be one of the standard things to check. Bathroom was a good size, but the bath was too short and it wasn’t a stand up shower, which was a real pain. You had to try and contort yourself to get both hands free to wash your hair – ok for someone 5 foot 4 but my husband struggled! And with no curtain the floor ends up quite wet. The Terrace bar is lovely and although we didn’t eat there, the food that was coming out looked very good in comparison to what we were overcharged for in other places. All in all for the money we paid €120 it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: krisbrightonuk
Reviews.Content: It took me two days surfing to find this hotel and discount the others and I,m so glad I did. We decided to have an extra quick break in the last week of the school holidays with our 5 year old son. The Terrass was the perfect hotel for us, we stayed for 4 nights . It was outstanding in many ways, the hotel is in a fantastic position to explore Paris easily. Near train, metro and bus connections. The rooms were a good size, gorgeous decor and very clean. I particularly loved the Villroy and Bosh bath! Breakfast was lovely as was the amazing selection of food and the staff could not have been more helpful. The roof terrace restaurant was always full which was our only issue as we wanted to eat there, so book early! We did however have drinks later in the evening, which gave a spectacular view of Paris. Will book again in the future. Gail Davis

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Location - book it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirs71
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2nt break at the Terrass Hotel & want to share our Pairs experience with you. We booked our transfer to the hotel with 'Paris Shuttle' (a disappointing start as we waited over half an hour to be collected from CDG & had a rude driver) so I would recommend taking the train/metro to the hotel or trying another transfer company? We were greeted politely on arrival at the hotel and were allocated room 508 - A great room with fantastic views over the city (+cemetery) looking straight at the Eifel tower. The room had a mini bar (prices quite steep) lovely huge bubble bath and very comfortable bed. The air con was in full working order, the bubble bath didn’t work to start off with but we called down to reception and someone came straight to our room and replaced the batteries in the remote and hey presto it worked (apart from a few bubble jets). The hotel is in a wonderful location on Montmartre and in walking distance to several metro stops, Blanche (by the Moulin Rouge & supermarket) Abbesses (quite alot of steps) and Place de Clichy (over the bridge). We used the metro a few times and found it really easy, cheap, efficient and clean! You can buy tickets for individual journeys or day/two day passes etc. Paris and the area around the hotel are clean, the people are friendly and so many sights to see within walking distance. The first afternoon we caught the hop on hop off bus (Le Open – 29 euro for one day or 32 euro for two days!) by the Blanche metro station and did the Montmartre route which helped us find our feet. That evening we enjoyed a superb meal in Le Basilica restaurant (out of the hotel, turn left and at the end of the road on your left) wonderful 3 course meal for 22 euro (or chose individually priced meals) great staff, food and service. The next morning after a wonderful breakfast we caught the metro to Musee d'Orsay to suss out where to catch a boat from for a cruise of the Seine and canals. We then hopped on the open top bus and completed the green route (centre Paris) taking in all the famous sights. After completing the green route we changed to the blue route. After a busy day sightseeing we returned and had a meal in a lovely little place up the road – something Gascon? (out of the hotel, turn left and on your right - on the corner of the first road to your right) the staff were great, food lush (fantastic salads) and service quick. We decided to visit the Eifel tower in the evening as the ques were shorter and it was cooler (40 in the day!), amazing sunset seen from the Eifel tower an experience not to miss and a must to go to the top! We took a taxi back (about 9.30pm roads quieter) which cost us 15 euro we ended our day by enjoying the summer evening temperature and relaxed on our balcony with a bottle of champagne (bought from the supermarket!) the light show at 11pm on the Eifel tower completed our day perfectly. Up early to catch the Metro to Musee d'Orsay then joined the Paris Canals cruise boat 17 euro for a 2.5hr cruise, Metro back and checked out at 1pm (Stephanie on reception very helpful and allowed us to keep the room for an extra hour) The concierge Louis was very accommodating and stored our luggage until we departed. Paris shuttle this time were very good, the driver was friendly and on time :) We had the most amazing weekend away and will definitely be booking again & returning to the Terrass. Good prices available for this hotel so search around. We will be returning to this hotel and Paris as we fell in love with the city and there is so much to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic hotel with magnificent view”
Reviews.Author: Ekleedv
Reviews.Content: We stayd for the second time in Terrass Hotel this spring. Be sure to book room 802, a junior suite on the top floor. Here you have the best view over paris, even better than the view from the Eiffel Tower. Staff is very helpfull, especially Danielle, the head concierge. If you have never been there, ask Danielle to make a special reservation at the nearby Moulin Rouge. You will be treated like a king! Some of the rooms have some little issues with maintenance, but overall the rooms are excellent. The top junior suite is a little bit expensive, but it is worth it. For dinner in Paris, go to "Bistro Mazarin" on the Rue Mazarine in the Quartier Latin. Definitly our favourit untill now.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to immerse yourself in French culture, start with Terrass in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSandra
Reviews.Content: If you seek out the whole French experience - not an American-style French hotel, Terrass Hotel is a wonder! The hotel is lovely! The ambiance of Montmartre (I'll write another review about Montmartre) was wonderful. Don't bother eating in the hotel. Prices andquality of food at local cafes and bakeries are far superior. Local wine is excellent, too. Do see the 7th floor terrace where you get a grand view of the city, including the Eiffel Tower. Accommodations were excellent - large room, tastefully decorated. Large bathroom. Everything worked and, when we needed additional towels or soap, they were delivered promptly. Concierge and other service people were knowledgeable, friendly and very helpful. Speaking some French is a plus;if you try, they will willingly speak English. Metro steps at Abbesses are a killer; best to use Blanche or you'll be tired before you get anywhere!. Also check out buses often more convenient than the metro. WEAR COMFORTABLE SHOES - lots of hills and cobblestones in Montmartre. They have a business center. However, the keyboard in French is dfferent and we found that very frustrating. See my review of Montmartre per se. Highly recommend this hotel as well as the location. SLachs USA

Reviews.Title: “This Montmarte Hotel won't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: paulgall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights on a "city break" from london and found the Hotel to be excellent and can only concur/agree with the majority of previous comments. The breakfast (included in our booking) has a considerable range of hot and cold food, enough variety to make a couple of delicious sandwiches for lunch. Louis the Concierge and all other staff were friendly and extremely helpful. It would appear that the hotel was renovated recently and our room was great (rm. 109) but keep in mind that there is little or no AC which makes it pretty noisy when the street windows are open during the night. Dont even think about complaining, they've heard it all before.I reckon they are saving the cost of AC as it was obviously working in the foyer. Take a bottle/cheese/ baguet to the roof and enjoy one of the best views of Paris. At night it's fantastic, stay until at least 11pm and the Eiffel Tower will light up like diamonds. You can go on the terrace after the restaurant is finished.Very romantic even for two old codgers like ourselves. We did not eat at the restaurant but in many of the local restaurants , however, the quality of food did vary so it's best to check what other diners are eating before sitting down. Le Relais Gascon is good. We loved the 95 bus as it transversed Paris from the right bank to the left past the Louvre and it was very easy to get on ond off and see the sights. The stop is 50metres to the right of the hotel. Louis can provide a bus route map which is all you need. Definitely buy a Visite pass for your stay as you can use it both in Metro and bus. Very convenient. You tend to carry too many maps around Paris , which can be very confusing. We went to our favorite restaurant, La Coupole in Montparnasse, very reasonable considering they sell the best oysters in Paris. Try to go as it is a true Parisian experience. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GoInternational
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times now and it has to be our favorite Hotel in Paris. All the rooms are decorated differently and are all lovely, well equipped, comfortable and quite luxurious. The roof terrace, with the perfect views over Paris, is now open all afternoon for drinks etc. Also the ground floor bar is nice for a drink before heading out for the evening and is perfect in the winter when they light the large roaring log fire! The location is great for the bars and cafes of Rue des Abbesses which is the perfect place for sitting out on a warm evening. Sacre-Coeur and Montmartre is only a few mins walk away. Also just outside the hotel stops the number 95 bus which takes you through to the main shops of Galeries Lafayette, Printemps etc then past the Opera and onto the Louvre, stopping just by the Pyramid – perfect. Restaurant Charlot in Place de Clichy (only a few mins walk from the hotel) is lovely with some of the best seafood in Paris, another favorite of our! Definitely looking forward to returning to the Terrass.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above-average quality with classical elegance style, a few steps from Montmartre.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Just aside from the center of the charming Montmartre neighborhood, Terrass Hotel retains a style of classical elegance in an attractive building. My room was decorated in old fashioned floral prints and striped/floral wallpaper. A distant view of the Eiffel Tower was visible from my room. The size was cramped, but not surprising for an older Paris hotel. The property is kept up quite well and the overall quality is above average, certainly. However the narrow hallways, elevator and rooms are all restrictive compared to modern standards. Location defines the Terrass in my mind. It is certainly a few steps aside from the daily bustle of the neighborhoods I visit as a tourist. But only a few steps. Within 5 minutes, you can be at the vibrant Place Clichy or the old hilly streets of Montmartre (with numerous popular small restaurants and trendy bars!).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view for a price”
Reviews.Author: FrenchFiona
