Reviews.Content: We were in France for 12 days for our honeymoon; we stayed in Paris for 3 nights at Le Meurice (see review), then went to the Loire Valley for 3 nights, then back to Paris/ Terrass Hotel for the last 5 nights. Our trip was planned by a French travel coach in Michigan; she evidently booked us "the best room in the hotel". It was room 802, on the top floor. The elevator goes only up to 7th floor, then you climb this cute curving staircase to the upper floor, where there are only two rooms. Our room was on the small side, and was elongated, BUT the whole wall facing the city was all large glass panels with two glass doors. We had a small terrace with a table and two chairs & lots of plants. Our view was unobstructed, and overlooked Paris, directly at the Eiffel Tower in the distance (not too far away, though). Down below was a very old cemetary with masoleums; very interesting but not creepy or scary. We could actually lay in bed every night, and watch the Eiffel tower all lit up- beautiful! The windows had really cool automatic metal rolling shades on the outside that rolled down at the press of a bedside button. Negatives about the hotel: the air conditioning did not work well. We could feel some slight cool air blowing, but not enought. We left the terrace doors open to get cool air in, but lots of street noise at night made it hard to sleep. Luckily (?), it turned cooler, so we didn't need the A/C. The maids did a mediocre job of cleaning; didn't replace shower gel when empty, and one day, we didn't have any washcloths. Place was never vacuumed during our entire stay. We ate at the Le Diapason restaurant on the 7th floor terrace on our first night. We had a reservation at 7:30pm (when they opened); the girl greeting us acted angry that we were there, and we were ignored for the first few minutes. We were seated with a view over Paris, but it was not as nice as the view from our own room. The service was poor and unattentive, and the food was just average; not the amazing meals we had eaten so far while in France. We did not eat any other meals there; we bought french pastries at the nearby boulangeries and ate them on our terrace for breakfast, and ate at nearby cafes for lunch. We found a WONDERFUL cafe at the end of the block behing the Terrass Hotel: it is called Le Basilic, and the food there was just as good as some of the fancy restaurants we had eaten at. We went there several times; I highly recommend the scallops with risotto. There were several markets nearby that we bought Evian water and Pepsi from & kept in our hotel room refrigerator, instead of paying their crazy mini-bar prices. On checkout, we came downstairs at 10am and told staff that our luggage needed to be brought down for our 10:30 taxi. Our taxi arrived at 10:25; no luggage yet, even though we had reminded them 3 times. Finally, with the taxi meter still running, our luggage was loaded at 10:45. The bellman looked surprised when we did not tip him this time; after all the taxi meter was already at 13 euros, and we did not want to reward him for this poor service. All in all, we would stay there again (only in room 802). There are several metro stations within a 5-10 minute walk, and Montmarte is very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh17
Reviews.Content: We managed to get 3 nights in a "classic double" for £314 on expedia. Almost everything that I have to say about the hotel is positive. The classic room was great and had a really nice, decently sized bathroom. The only (minor) complaint about the room was that the air conditioning did not work. It did not appear to be switched on. This was really only an issue on the first night when it was really humid. Otherwise, the temperature of the room was very comfortable. Don't bother with breakfast though as it costs 17 euros. The Cafe Qui Parle round the corner offers a nice breakfast for 6 euros. The hotel is in the nicest part of Montmatre. My advice is that you use Abysses Metro station (this is much nicer than the alternatives).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: cbrcpl
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just (yesterday) returned from a week in Paris, staying at the Terrass Hotel in Montmartre. Given that we had booked on line we were a bit nervous but I have to say that disappeared the moment we stepped through the door and were met by the wonderful staff. Check in went smoothly, we had been upgraded and could see the Tower from the window (with a lean ;-) ), the room itself was great (clean and spacious) and worth every cent. A particular stand out from our time there was Luis the concierge. Luis was pleasant, witty, helpful to the extreme and just a hell of a nice guy to deal with. He knew the city, the tours to take (and avoid), the sights to see and the places to go. Our biggest disappointment of the whole trip was not having the chance to say goodbye to him when we left (we checked out before he started for the day). If you stay there, ask for Luis - there isn’t a thing he can’t help with. Check out went well and I have to say we were sorry to leave the place. The only downside, if it is one, was that the rooms weren’t cleaned until late in the day meaning that we had to use the same towels for two days straight... oh the woe ;-) Terrass Hotel has now become the standard by which we judge future accommodation. We can fully recommend it to any traveller. We booked through Expedia.com and found the place to be extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: THFC1978
Reviews.Content: Lovely place - classy hotel in a wonderful area. Our first trip Paris - we took advice from friends where to stay and Montmartre was suggested. A little bit away from the centre, 3 or 4 stops on the Metro, but with so much charm; all cobbled streets with open fronted bars and restaurants, as well as the Sacre Coeur. We arrived via Eurostar and the hotel is only 10 minute taxi ride away, and the hotel were happy to check us in a couple hours early, as we arrived at midday. The hotel was very smart, room was very comfortable and we could even see the Eiffel tower from bed! Free internet connection was a bonus, and hotel bathroom connoisseurs won' t be disappointed! The only downside was that the air-con wasn't working. No mention of this as we checked in nor a note in the room, we were told by reception when we asked that it wasn't working and wouldn't be for a month. This could have been dealt with better (i.e a note in the room "Je suis désolé, air-cons not working, but please have a drink on us in the bar this evening"). Still, this didn't affect us too much so no real complaint there. We didn't use the bar or the restaurant, but both looked great and in hindsight I think we may have missed out by not eating at the restaurant judging by reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself at the Terrass”
Reviews.Author: katieBeardie
Reviews.Content: Booked the Terrass through Expedia to celebrate my son's 23rd birthday. Emailed them in the hope we may get an upgrade, but they asked for additional 50 euros per night for room with a view. The terrace on the 7th floor well made up for the lack of view from our room. Take a look at night, the whole of Paris is lit up before your eyes and on every hour the Eiffel Tour sparkles brilliantly for 5 mins, don't forget your bottle of wine or Champagne, sit back and enjoy the amazing view. We stayed in room 619 which had a partial view of yet another building and slight view of Paris. However the room was bright and clean, a little on the small side but the bathroom well made up for it, beautifully tiled with large bath, separate tiled semi circular shower and double sinks and fabulous towels. As it was Easter they did provide a chocolate souvenir presented in a beautiful box, thought at first it was a fridge magnet displaying the Eiffel Tower but the smell of chocolate gave it away. The hotel staff where very pleasant and helpful. We booked a table at the Le Diapason Restaurant within hotel and was pleasantly surprised and full after a delicious meal and dessert. The staff were very attentive and a two course meal for two with wine and coffee came to 77 Euros, which I thought was fair. If you are travelling from CDG airport I suggest you book Paris Shuttle transfer through Expedia, it cost £17 each one way. The hotel charges 75 Euros each one way. All in all a lovely hotel and a great location, less than 2 mins walk from Rue de Abbesses which is full of lively bars and cafes and Sacre Cour. For movie goers visit the Du Moulin cafe where Amelie was filmed on Rue de Lepic. The Hotel is also opposite the Montemartre cemetery, worth a stroll on a nice day, many famous people are buried there. We used the Abbesses metro, but be warned, for people who do not like using lifts, it’s a long haul back to the top, we used the Pigalle metro to return, only 5 minutes from the hotel. There are cheaper hotels in Montemartre but certainly return to the Terrass for a special occasion. Hope you found this helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel...but...”
Reviews.Author: wispasareyum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over easter. The hotel: Is very nice. We booked a deluxe room and got upgraded to a suite as it was full. 2 big issues however which we were not happy with. The air conditioning did not work. I rang the reception straight away and the reaction was quite rude. They told me the air con wasn't working in the hotel and that they didn't know when it would be fixed - there wasn't any apology and it was made out that it wasn't such a big deal. For a 4 star hotel I was not happy with this. The next morning we woke up at 9.30am to the deafening sound of hammers and drills in the room next to ours. Also a a bit upsetting! The staff did however, agreed that the noise wasn't acceptable and agreed to move us to a suite on the next floor below. The rest of our stay was great and the beds were really really comfy. The location: The hotel is in a great location just at the bottom of Montmartre....make sure to take a left out of the hotel door and you'll find yourself wandering around the lovely cafe lined streets of montmartre. Take a right at the door and over the cemetary and you'll find yourself in Place de Clichy...a very touristy square with a lot of tatty bars and cafes...but still fine. I'd recommend a left first though!

Reviews.Title: “Beutifull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsOconnor
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be wonderfull, we had agreat time, and found that it was in the best location for walking around the city, we found a beutifull little Pitza restraunt just 10 mins walk from the hotel, the rooms were exeptionally clean, the staff were very friendly and keen to help. The bar is verry comfortable at night and the bar tender never let our drink run dry we didnt even have to ask. Their is a shop just over the bridge from this hotel selling everything you could need at a very reasonable price. Take a walk to the park and just sit watching the world go by it so romantic, very picturesk. The taxi drivers are mad though be warned put your seatbelt on!!! We had a really geat time could not fault a thing, we came away with some brilliant memories of our romantic weekend in paris. P.S do the river cruise if you can you get to see so much of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Work In Progress in this place...”
Reviews.Author: MPicchioni
Reviews.Content: Just left Terrass Hotel after staying there for 3 nights for a business trip in Paris. I was given room 205. The whole floor smells of smoke and burnt. Looks like there was a fire at the ground floor of this hotel in the very recent past and as a result a whole section of this hotel smells of smoke. I asked my colleagues and it was the same on the 3rd and 5th floor. Notice that some of the rooms in the other section of the hotel are being refurbished. The room itself was OK, but really nothing special with the basic features and facilities you would expect for a 180E/night hotel. My colleagues experienced problems with the remote control of the TV, the TV itself, the lights in the room and the hairdrier in the bathroom. Breakfast was good quality but the selection was limited when compared to what you normally get in other hotels of same level. Last but not least, at 4:17am of my first night in this hotel, the fire alarm went off on the 2nd floor for a good 15 minutes. Needless to say, the whole floor was woken up ad no one really knew what to do. No one from staff showed up. Following morning reception confirmed it was a small technical problem with the alarm... I would personally not to back to this hotel and would recommend to stay away for a while before they sort things out...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Parisian Find!”
Reviews.Author: BelleCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel, and chose to book my family and I here for the holidays. It was a fantastic decision! The hotel is lovely ~ well-appointed furnishings, great staff, good (but expensive!) hotel bar, great hotel restaurant, and a beautiful terrace to view the Eiffel Tower. We had three rooms in total ~ and they were each distinctly wonderful, which gave the hotel such character. The beds were comfy, our bathroom was huge, and the service was top notch. Only one of our three rooms had a view of the Eiffel Tower, though all rooms were great. Overall, Montmarte is a great neighborhood, though I advise travelers to stay away from the seedy tourist trap just a few streets away. There are plenty of good bars, cafes and restaurants around the hotel (try Luc Salsedo on Rue Maccarani). The Sacre Couer is nearby, and if you wander through the streets, you may find a windmill!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with large room & views to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: andreas_violeta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the centre of Montmatre, the metro is just 5 minutes walk from it. We stayed 4 nights in the hotel which is very clean, smells good, our room (405) was much bigger than expected, very clean and had a view over the cemetery of Montmatre, Paris and with the Eiffel tower at the background. Breakfast is delicious and takes place in the lovely modern restaurant of the hotel, but remember not to be later than 10am ‘cause the maitre is a bit insolent with that. The restaurant is also a good place to have dinner (nice and food is good). The staff is polite, easy and helpful. The hotel has a bar with fire place and live piano music all afternoons. The only thing I’d like to say is that curtains would make a difference while taking a shower. We will surely go back to that hotel when we go to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: littleireland
Reviews.Content: While the staff were very nice and room comfortable the decor is a bit faded for this kind of price. The tiles where chipped around the bath and there were very few extras in the bathroom which you would expect like even a nail file. The minibar charged 4 euros for a small bottle of water or juice. While the location is great there are better prices to be had in paris. Try Le relais Gascon restaurant close by for good value food though.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mise_8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful romantic trip to Paris for our tenth wedding anniversary. Terrass hotel was perfect. Great location. Lovely room. Individual touch. Not like staying in a big chain hotel. Magnificent views of the eiffel tower from our room on the top floor. Buffet breakfast was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, lovely decor”
Reviews.Author: saoirsemoo
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, bed very comfortable. It was clean, had tea/coffee making facilities, the bathroom was spacious. We requested a room with a view of Paris upon booking, and we were rewarded with views of Paris, along with the nightly light show from the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast buttet was delicious, which made the trips around Paris easier with a full stomach. A wide variety of continental breakfast foods available, including eggs if requested. The metro is approx 5 minutes away, and the Montmartre/ Sacre Coeur just up the hill behind the hotel. There are several lovely restaurants in close proximity to the hotel, which we dined out at. Simple but delicious french fare. Staff were friendly and had suggestions on where was good to eat. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Terrass Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MetEngTourist
Reviews.Content: Room very good; well laid-out. The room faced into an inner court rather than onto the main road so it was very quiet. The front desk staff were great, especially Daniele Lidon the chief concierge. However, the overall experience was down-graded by the poor service in the restaurant. Service was slow, and most of them didn't seem to know what to do. The kitchen was very slow, taking 15 minutes just to produce 2 poached eggs. This was disappointing; otherwise the rest of the hotel is very good. It's position is also good relative to transportation and the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hobart_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Terrass for 4 nights in May for our honeymoon. As we expected the room was small but very pleasant with a great view over Paris, including the Eiffel Tower. The location is quite good with easy access to the Metro. Rue des Abbesses, which runs along the front of the hotel, is full of shops and restaurants. The breakfast at Terrass is very good, they have the usual spread but will also do eggs if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: thediscoqueen
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon in Paris and couldn't wait to commend the staff of the Terrass Hotel. All of the concierges were extremely knowledgable and made us feel like old friends. Our room was exceptionally clean, comfortable and had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from our bed. The breakfast buffet which was included in our room rate was delicious and plentiful. The rooftop restaurant provided an exceptional view of the Eiffel Tower and Paris and was home to many a romantic moment for us. The hotel location is a 5 minute walk from the Metro with an easy connection to just about any destination in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: inca_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Terrass Hotel in Paris. We had a Deluxe Room on the top floor with view on the Eiffel Tower. The view was absolutely fabulous, especially at night. The bedroom was clean and had an above average size for a Parisian hotel. We had a king bed which was confortable. The toilet was apart from the bathroom, which is always nice. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi, unfortunately, we found that the bubbles were not that powerful. We also regretted that there was no curtain in order to take the shower. The breakfast buffet was impressive. Finally, the personnel was nice and the concierge helpful. The hotel is on one of the main metro line of Paris so it’s really easy to go to the center of Paris. Overall, we loved our stay at the Terrass Hotel and we’ll go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Regular_site_user
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant weekend at the Terrass Hotel, stayed in a lovely traditional suite, room 605, with excellent views over Paris. The king size bed was great, and we slept well, thanks to double glazing and the shutters. The hotel is in a brilliant location in the middle of Montmartre with lots of great bars, restaurants, and small shops. We were disappointed by breakfast there though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, good location”
Reviews.Author: Dovaroma
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Terrass was perfect for our one night stay, - my daughter and I arrived late afternoon after booking online - the Receptionist was very friendly and we were soon in the lift on the way to our room, (416). As soon as we opened the door the room looked very luxurious, decorated in blue and yellow with a large glass table & chairs, kettle & hospitality basket. The en-suite bathroom was lovely, with two sinks, corner bath / shower & separate toilet. Ample towels and lovely complimentary toiletries. Electric shutters and air conditioning (although this was a bit noisy so we turned it off!) - our accommodation was very spacious and comfortable. Breakfast the following morning was in the restaurant downstairs, you can choose where you sit, and tea or coffee is served to your table. We took from the buffet - bread, coissants, pain au chocolates, ham, cheese, yoghurts, fresh fruit & orange juice - a hot breakfast was also available if you prefer something cooked. The Terrass is within easy walking distance of The Moulin Rouge, and the Sacre Coeur / Monmatre. There are many cafes and bars within a 5 minute walk - however our room was very quite and we were not disturbed at all during the night. The nearest Metro is "Blanche" which is a lovely Art Deco sign, directly opposite the Moulin Rouge. - (to get to the Terrass - walk infront of the Moulin Rouge away from the metro to the end of that street, - then take a right (metal bridge over cemetary) the Terrass is on the corner and very easy to find!). I would love to return to Paris one day, - and would definately consider staying at the Terrass again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the upgrade to a suite”
Reviews.Author: Pleasure2holiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and chose it after having read good reviews on Tripadvisor and finding a good deal online, as there are so many hotels in Paris we didn't know where to start. We took a reviewer's advice and upgraded to a suite which meant we ended up with a decent sized room and bathroom (with separate toilet) and a perfect view of the city and Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was nice as you have a choice of a bath or a walk in shower. There are twin wash basins but probably a bit too close together to actually use simultaneously. The hotel is situated next to a main road which worried me when we arrived but I had no trouble with the noise. The hotel overlooked a cemetary but that didn't bother us, as it was quiet and didn't block the view down the hill to the city. There are a couple of metro stations in walking distance or if you have time it's only a 45 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. We also tried a bistro within 5 minutes walk of the hotel recommended in Time Out 2008 (see website if you haven't bought the book) and the food was amazing. It was called Chez Toinette on 20 rue Germain-Pilon. Another night we tried the hotel's roof top terrace restaurant as we like dthe idea of eating outside with a view. It was nice but fancy food and came with a price tag. Hotel staff were very polite. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: clobella
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night stay, booked at very reasonable rate. Room whilst small was very comfortable and clean. Good bathroom with plenty of towels. Also had tea and coffee facilities, not always found in French hotels. I think it has been recently refurbished and it is very nice indeed. Lovely lobby area in nice setting with plenty of sofas and chairs. Breakfast had good choice and everyone was very pleasant. Location is great - a previous reviewer made mention of it being near metro stations which weren't pleasant late at night. We used Abbesse which was at the end of the lovely road alongside the Terrass and there was no problem at all. Yes hotel is opposite a cemetary but it's very interesting with some famous people buried there and believe it or not worth a look! Would definitely stay here again. The area is just before the real touristy part of Montmartre and there were lovely shops and cafes etc along the Rue des Abbesses which were always packed with mainly locals and students.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little 4 star in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MelWLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: This little hotel deserves its 4 stars: great location in walking distance (albeit up steep hill!) from Montmartre in one direction and place de l opera via the Pigalle in the other. Clean and comfortable, roms on the small side but adequate; great views from some but not others so be sure to ask when you book. Fabulous views from the little terrace restaurant on the roof, although the food was very arty and left us all hungry! Cosy bar area on ground floor and good service from both bar and concierge staff. They like it if you speak french but are all happy to speak english if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “the wonderful Terrass Hotel”
Reviews.Author: madamew
Reviews.Content: My mother and I have just returned from a glorious week in Paris. We stayed in Montmartre, at the Terrass Hotel, known for its stunning rooftop view of Paris. The hotel was lovely and very clean. The staff, including the Concierge Madame Daniele, Nicolas, Guy and Yves were all kind and helpful. The location was terrific. We felt like we were on top of the world (and we were, overlooking the incredible 'City of Light"). I wholeheartedly recommend the Terrass Hotel, and a visit to Paris, to anyone interested in the finer things in life: beauty, good food, art, music and the sublime world of France.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely well run hotel with warm friendly and welcomng staff”
Reviews.Author: lugsy
Reviews.Content: I discovered the Terrass 10 years ago and have been staying there regularly ever since on my frequent business visits to Paris. The location is convenient for all the main tourist venues and is in the quaint Montmartre district. The entrance foyer is warm and welcoming and the Reception staff are always wonderfully friendly, helpful and courteous. The rooms are well appointed but small and always scrupulously clean. The restaurant is beautiful with a superb ambiance and the restaurant staff are delightful and the food also. I don't like having to stay away from home on business but I love this hotel which I regard as a home form home and I will stay nowhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “nice retreat and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Guido1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this lovely hotel in the Montmatre area. We had a junior suite since we took our son of 3 with us. Spacious and well-maintained room with a lovely view over Paris and lit-up Eiffel tower at night time. Bathroom was relatively small but still had a bath and separate shower. The location of the hotel was perfect for taking trips down to either the heart of the city or to stay close to Sacre Coeur area which is just around the corner. Good restaurants closeby (La Mascotte in Rue des Abbesses) but stay away from the tourists traps on Place du Tetre on Monmatre. Another tip is Moulin de la Galette on rue lepic.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: DallasSandyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Hotel Terrass in the Montmartre area of Paris was beyond our expectations on every score. Our junior suite was lovely, well appointed, extremely comfortable and spacious, even for three people, my husband and I and our 16 year old daughter. The view was incredible. Paris lay at our feet from the small balcony and the Eiffel Tower greeted us to our left. The food - both room service and the restaurant - was exquiste, delicious and beautifully presented. The staff and service were magnificent. Everyone was extremely helpful, especially Daniele, the Concierge. She made us feel welcome and our stay in Montmartre was so much more because of her attention to detail and friendly manner. We would highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay there again whenever we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - luxurious and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: wolvespremier
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Paris to see Robbie Williams at the Parc des Princes before we jetted off to Marbella on the second part of our trip. We stayed at the Terrass hotel in Paris for 3 nights. The hotel which is situated on a hillside was luxurious and the views were fabulous. We stopped in a room which had a double jacuzzi shower. The room was spacious and extremely secure with remote control shutters, however the view from our particular room was of other parts of the hotel though I am sure there are rooms with amazing views at the front of the hotel - so try and get one of those! I would recommend you eat in the Terrass restaurant (Terrace) which is situated if my memory serves me on the 5th floor and is open air. The views from the restaurant are amazing and at night the Eiffel Tower is lit up which makes it very special, the food was great and fine wine was on tap which helped creat a fabulous ambience and a great taste of Paris. The location is perfect, not too busy with tourists but mainly locals mulling around the chic boutiques and coffee shops. It is situated idylicly in the Montmartre region and within walking distance (though up hills) of the Sacre Couer. There are markets nearby which sell canvass paintings and lots of shops selling original art at very competitive prices. The food outside the hotel was great too, the smell of croissants filled the air and the whole trip felt relaxed as thats how the locals seem to carry out their day to day activities. The staff were helpful and friendly, but book early to get into the restaurant as its very popular. The staff kindly squeezed us in on a cancellation and nothing was too much for them. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable trip to Paris which was underpinned by my stay at the Terrass!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: jasemfc
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a weekend in Paris and thought the Terrass was a lovely hotel. We decided to stay just outside the main part of paris...not far though and in doing so learn a little more about how the locals spend their evenings. We have recently stayed at the Ritz for our honeymoon which was really nice, however this hotel gives you a feel of having the personal touch. The local restaurants were really reasonably priced compared to staying near the champs. We stayed in room 603 which was a suite this was very clean and tidy and the only issue we had was the fact the hotel was having some renovation work carried out, which occasionally was noticeable with some drilling etc. Mind you the hotel manager sent up a complementary bottle of champagne for this minor inconvenience. Would certainly go back to this very nice hotel...Well worth a try

Reviews.Title: “The Terrass exposed....”
Reviews.Author: LAWRIET
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer , we were in Paris to celebrate a special birthday and the charming lady who welcomed us on a dreadful wet and windy afternoon gave us the spledid room with a view - 801. Paris lay exposed in front of our eighth floor eyrie, high on the Monmartre hill ,and the view was indeed magnificent. Unfortunatly , the weather didnt get any better and whilst we were having dinner , the picture window blew open and we returned to a somewhat dishevelled room. We were relocted immediatly and without any problem to another very nice ,compact room , but sadly didnt have that fabulous view anymore. The hotel staff were warm,friendly and polite in every department, the hotel itself was exceptionally comfortable in a homely sort of way and we will definately stay there again in the future. We would even ask for room 801 , but check the weather forecast first. A note regarding the restaurant menu (english translated version) - the shellfish sausage with sea scum (sic) was very tasty , the 'scum' being a foamy sauce!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: wowfactor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect. Located in a quaint part of Paris, near to lots of good bars and restaurants and near to a couple of metro stops. Our room was 801, on the top floor. As it was a birthday treat we'd asked for a view and were not disappointed! And, as a previous reviewer has said, it's like having your very own (well appointed) attic all to yourself. The room was well decorated and very clean and we liked the fact that the decor was a bit different to your usual souless hotel room. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a bit hit and miss (especially the hot stuff) and the internet in the business centre didn't work. But minor points in an overall excellent stay. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bal_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Terrass from Dec 29th till Jan 3rd 2008. The hotel is very well located with the Abessess metro stop nearby, which takes you to the centre of Paris. It's also in a lovely area with a real community feel with some fantastic restaurants and shops. As a consequence my partner and I ate many of our evening meals there. As for the hotel, the rooms were clean (although small I have stayed in smaller) and the staff were pleasant and hepful. My favourite thing was the spacious power shower which ALWAYS had hot water (again something I tend to have bad luck with!). The only downside was maybe the lack of English language channels on the TV. It wasn't a big deal as we didn't watch much TV but they did have Italian and German language channels and all we could watch was BBC World! Also as vegetarian there wasn't a great choice at the breakfast buffet (which relies on its cold cuts). The terrace itself has amazing views of the city and we brought the New Year in on it whilst drinking champagne. All in all a great hotel which I would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Sur_la_route
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in Montmartre. Great location and if you can get a room with a view, then you're in heaven. It's beautiful and quiet although the rooms are on the smallish side.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ch33kyMonk3y
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel!! I booked a standard room with Hotels Direct for a bargain price. We arrived in Paris on Saturday morning and booked into the hotel and decided to upgrade to a deluxe suite after seeing the standard room. For an extra 90 euroes (for two nights) the room was huge, had a jacuzzi, a view of the Eiffell Tower and a balcony. The people were friendly, the concierge helpful and the bar comfortable and relaxing. I go to Paris once a year and this has to be the best hotel I have stayed in so far. Rooms are normally tiny and the reception staff are rude to say the least - so this hotel was a complete breath of fresh air!! Breakfast was great, I didn't expect a great deal but asked for fried eggs, bacon and some sausages and what arrived was a tasty selection of fresh continental breakfast! There was also a wide selection of cold meats, cereals, breads and croissants to keep anyone happy. PLease note that this hotel if anywhere else wouldn't be as amazing for the price but having stayed in MANY hotels in Paris this definitely tops the lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ElaineRobert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel during the rugby World Cup, and had a wonderful time. Our room was sylish, comfortable and spacious (by Paris standards). The staff are efficient and helpful. After the match we had cocktails in the bar and were entertained by the pianist - and the other guests too! Drinks are quite pricey for us Brits, but if you drink slowly (as the Parisians do), you won't be too suprised at the bill at the end of your stay. Anyway, it was worth it. Great area too - Monmartre is like a village made up of interesting shops very good restaurants and jazz bars. Prefer this area to any other in Paris. Would definately book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Area”
Reviews.Author: pastilles-la-menthe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Very clean. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast excellent – great poached eggs. As we had a baby with us, and I emailed beforehand to check on cot availability, they upgraded us for free to a junior suite. Could see top of Eifel Tower from the room. View from roof terrace on top floor is really good. Try to get a package deal. Company we used gave us three nights for price of two, so was very good value. Location Loved it. Metro strike meant we spent a whole day in the area and it was great. Close to Sacre Coeur with it’s stunning setting. Lots of shops, restaurants and bakers nearby. Shop selling Organic or ‘ bio’ stuff in St around the back. Good size supermarket nearby as well. Bus stops outside hotel for Eiffel Tower and for the Louvre. Taxi from Gare du Nord 11 Euros. Only catch official taxis that have a meter. Cowboys outside wanted 70 Euros for same journey. Preferred this area to other parts of Paris. Last time we stayed near Eiffel Tower, but this was better. Transport Strike advice. Buses were running but during rush hour were packed. – impossible to get on with a push chair. Queue for taxis directly outside gare du nord were massive, but a short work out an alternate exit and then two minutes over the road was another taxi rank that was much quieter. Some Metros were running though with not a bad service so all in all I wouldn’t let it put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous service.”
Reviews.Author: hebrides2006
Reviews.Content: We were slightly concerned after reading some of the reviews but the hotel itself and the service we received whilst there was fantastic. This was our third trip to Paris and we found this hotel particularly spacious compared to other hotels of the same rating that we'd stayed in before. There is a lovely bar/lounge area (although we were disappointed that there was no pianist in August) and the bedroom and bathroom were very well appointed. The restaurant on the ground floor was much bigger than any we have encountered before and the expense of dining on the roof terrace is well worth it (make sure you wear something warm!). Don't be put off by some of the photographs on this site - the rooms are decorated in what appears to be an odd grey colour but they really are lovely in reality and the walls are lined with material, not paper. Look out for the murals on the lift doors too - very unusual! It really is a lovely hotel and the staff are extremely helpful. We have planned to take relatives with us when we next visit in August 2008. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Choice”
Reviews.Author: cphs73-75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated my 50th birthday in Paris. We selected this hotel based on other reviews we had read. It was a fabulous choice. Montmarte is the highest point in Paris with great views. Ask for a room with a view, we were thrilled when our room had a balcony with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel was located near 2 Metro stops. There are wonderful cafe's and great restaurants in the area. The hotel staff was helpful but not overly friendly. Definitely a good choice and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by the quality”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireRunner
Reviews.Content: Booked this after reading positive reviews. Was looking for something a bit special for our 5 day honeymoon. Everything about the hotel was great. Rooms were cleaned daily. Views from the Terrace on the 7th Floor of the Eiffel Tower and Montmartre Cemetery added a little bit of "Paris" to the stay. We ate at the restaurant once in the evening, and although a bit pricey, had an amazingly good menu and food that could not be faulted. The location is also ideal as it is a 5 to 10 minute walk away from Moulin Rouge, Sacre Coeur and Metro station. Numerous bars and cafes are also ideal for nightime strolling and people watching. Only downside, although it didn't detract from the experience, were the opening times of the restaurant and availability of room service. We arrived on a Sunday evening at 7pm and both the restaurant and room service were unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel & area”
Reviews.Author: ali18
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 3 nights at the hotel - we upgraded to a suite which was huge for a Paris hotel. The rooms were lovely – although we were lower floor we didn’t have a view which was a shame & quite noisy. The hotel itself is spotless & staff very helpful. My only real complaint was the price it is expensive especially as you have to pay extra for breakfast, there are also no facilities as such there. The mini bar was as usual horrendously priced The location is fantastic. Would I stay there again – probably not due to the price & the fact I would like to explore other areas of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Hugo-Balentine
Reviews.Content: I’m a little late in writing this, ok so its well over a year, but it would be rude if I didn't mention this wonderful hotel. I stayed here with my girlfriend (who I would be proposing to on this trip) After months of research and very careful planning, our trip was almost disrupted due to high security problems at Heathrow airport last year. We were extremely lucky to have even flown out. Due to the problems at Heathrow we did not receive our luggage and all we had were our passports and our cash cards. That was all!! The Terrass was so helpful managing to provide us with t-shirts, toothbrushes, cleaning products etc. If this wasn’t enough they even upgraded us to a junior suit (if memory serves me correctly it was room 704). The room was exactly as I imagined it to be, if not better. It was clean, neat and very spacious with a clear and uninterrupted view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was very large and well kept. The location is perfect. Tucked away in the traditional French streets, surrounded by cafes and small shops, although busy it becomes quiet towards the evening so do not worry. By foot you could reach all the main streets leading to the main attractions this should take around 20 minutes. Do not miss the Moulin Rouge. It’s an amazing show and a must on any trip to Paris. Again the Terrass helped by booking the tickets. Due to the smart dress code we needed to buy clothes at short notice. The Terrass couldn't have been kinder by drawing a detailed map to all the local shops were we could get as dressed up as possible. All in all this is a wonderful hotel which I cannot wait to visit again. A must if you are to stay in Paris. & if you're wondering she did say yes!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: asaspacey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as a part of our honeymoon in Paris. Wow! The junior suite was amazing! The rooms were clean and massive for french standards. I will be coming back here every year. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. Go, book it now. Book the Junior Suite - don't bother with inclusive breakfast - go to the local supermarket and take your breakfast on the balcony. If you want to stay in Paris, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Terrass!”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the other reviewers for giving very accurate reviews and advice. We stayed for two nights just last week and found the hotel to be very nice, and in a great location. We had room #801, one of two on the very top floor (you have to walk up a small circular staircase to get there) - it was a cozy, bright room with a terrific view of the Eiffel Tower and looking down on the Cemeterie Montmarte. We felt like we had a special room in the attic! As others recommended, I emailed the hotel to confirm the reservation, noting the special occasions (my bday and our 20th wedding anniversary) and asked for a view room; they responded a few days later granting that request. Unfortunately it was too windy to enjoy dinner on the terrass, which looked lovely (on the 7th floor with a sweeping view), and we didn't have breakfast at the hotel either, so can't comment on the food. There is a great patisserie just down the street on the same block as the hotel that had excellent pastries and baguette sandwiches. Yum, I'm still thinking about the almond pain au chocolate. We found a great restaurant up on the hill "Le Relaise de Butte" - one of the better meals we had in Paris all week! The only part of our experience that seems to differ from others is the service/friendliness of staff. We were checked in a very business like manner, there were other guests being handled so we were basically just handed our key (the bellman helped with the luggage). After that, every time we entered or left the hotel the front desk staff were heads-down working at their desks and never looked up or greeted us in any way, even when the lobby was empty. When my husband went down for a recommendation for my birthday dinner, asking for a nice restaurant, they directed us to two different bars down the street. We walked by both and it was clearly a bar scene - no food was even being served! The front door area was still under construction, it is supposed to be done in the next few days, it was no issue at all. However, when we asked about the internet, we were told that the WiFi doesn't work on the 8th floor and since they were having trouble with the cabled internet access they would only charge us 6 Euro to use the WiFi in the lobby (rather than complimentary per the other reviewer) instead of the usual 22/day!!! We came across a great little street on our last morning, wish we found it sooner - it's about 2 blocks up the side street (St. Joseph?) - turn right and you will find a few blocks of great produce, butcher, patisseries/chocolate shops, fabulous cheese shop - everything you would need to put together a delicious picnic!! One more thing - just this past month the City of Paris has installed over 10,000 "rental bikes" in stations around the city. You pay for a day/week/month pass from a kiosk, get a card, and use it to unlock a bike that you can use and then return to any other location. There are two brand-new stations just outside the door of the Terrass. Montmarte is pretty hilly but what a great option! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Alirog
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Hotel in good location, lots of restaurants nearby for evening & near several metro stops for sightseeing. If you can get the 170 Euros inc breakfast rate this is a great deal - if you have to pay extra for breakfast I wouldn't bother, have it nearby. Our rooms were fairly small,but not bad sized for Paris & had nice bathrooms. The staff were ok, but did not go out of their way to welcome us or explain where breakfast was served etc. If you stay here, seek out Chez Toinette which is a bistro about 5 minutes from hotel, its serves great french food in a friendly atmosphere. If I was staying in Paris again I would consider the Terrass Hotel, but only if the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't assume that you will be able to have dinner here.”
Reviews.Author: LaurieEngland
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, not huge but we have stayed in smaller 4* hotel rooms in London. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant on the first night of our 4 night stay. The food was fabulous if a little expensive. We decided that we would economise on our lunches out and eat in the hotel restaurant every evening. We attempted to book for the next evening and were told that they were full for the next two evenings and closed on Sundays. This was not actually true. they closed for three evenings. So we were staying in a 4* hotel but unable to eat there in the evenings. We had booked for breakfast, and, after reading reviews here I was interested to see if we would be offered a cooked breakfast. The earlier comments were correct. It seems to be a closely guarded secret that a cooked meal is available. We were told 'it's a buffet'. I said "actually we would prefer a cooked breakfast". This was immediately agreed to. I asked for bacon scrambled eggs and tomatoes. They had run out of bacon (9.15 a.m.) but offered sausages instead. The food was beautifully cooked and presented. The weekend morning staff were very obliging but again no offer of cooked food was made, but quickly provided when we asked for it.They ran out of bacon on Monday too. How strange to do that twice in four days, but the sausages were an excellent replacement. Food was very disappointing in the other places nearby. We were not told that the hotel restaurant sometimes opens for lunch. If we had known we could have had a leisurely lunch after checking out while we waited for the time for our eurostar journey back. Instead we sat at a pavement cafe in a torrential thunderstorm eating Italian food. There is no way of walking into the restaurant at the moment without leaving the building and coming back in a door further down the road because work is being done to the passageway through. Monmarte in general was very dirty and down at heel. It is 20 years since we last visited and we won't bother to go back again. The staff were 'mixed' some very nice and really helpful 'Nicholas' and the female staff particularly, but most of the male staff were very 'Parisien' in thier attitudes(and not in a good way). Generally the hotel was good but little things could have made it better. Our luggage was stored for us after we checked out but it was filthy when it was brought back to us. Not a big problem but a reflection on the hotel nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: isladuffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on the third floor with a lovely view over Montmartre towards the Eiffel tower. the hotel is a short walk from the metro and plenty of cafes bars and restaurants. the staff were very helpful and the room was a nice size. there was some lovely tiling in the bathroom which was very quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing junior suite”
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just got back from a birthday trip to Paris where we stayed at the Terrass Hotel for 3 nights with Eurostar. We booked the trip through Expedia.com and had chosen this hotel based primarily on the positive reviews we had read on this website and others, recommendations from previous travellers and the hotel's reputation. We definately weren't disappointed! A truly amazing hotel, beautifully located and quite a gem to find! Room - We had originally booked a standard double room for bed only but I emailed the hotel a few days before the trip to confirm the reservation. The manager got back to me within an hour and offered a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite for the special occasion. This was by far the nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in, extremely spacious with air conditioning, mood lighting, stylish furnishings and the bathroom came complete with a steam shower which was truly appreciated after a tiring day's sightseeing! We did see a standard room on passing and can honestly say it was very very small. Try and get a junior suite if you are able to as it is worth it for the space and luxury. Breakfast - Again, the general consensus of the the hotel reviews on this and many other websites was to avoid the breakfast (which was very pricey) so we opted to find fresh croissants and orange juice from the many patisseries in the local area and took them back to the hotel. Hotel staff - The reception staff weren't exactly welcoming but polite enough - I am told this is typical of many french hotels. However, the porters and concierge were very warm and friendly, going out of their way to help us at every opportunity. Area - Montmartre is one of the most beautiful neighbourhoods in Paris, full of gorgeous patisseries, boulangeries, wine cellars and more. The vilage itself is very busy, full of locals and has a very typical french feel. The Sacre Coeur is a short walk from the hotel on the Montmartre Hill and definately worth a visit for one of the highest, most spectacular views of the city. Check-out - Our experience of the hotel until check out had been of a very high standard. However, it was tainted slightly on receiving a bill for the room and so we had to show our paperwork to prove it had already been paid for even though we'd given them this on check-in. On the bill there was also E50 euro's for items taken from the mini-bar. My boyfriend and I had not touched the mini-bar but their quickness of withdrawing the items did smack a bit of a try-on. Be careful for this as it has been mentioned in previous reviews. Value - On the whole, it was great value for the Eurostar. The Eurostar was by far the quickest, most pleasant way to travel and I would definately recommend this to anyone taking a short trip to Paris for it saves a lot of time and check-in is very quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose the Terrass Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NorwichJackal
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided to go to Paris for the first time, in May this year for a week to celebrate my birthday. I spent hours on the internet looking at reviews and prices of hotels and finally chose the Terrass Hotel. I did not once regret it and would recommend the hotel to anyone going to Paris. OK, first of all, I think its fair to get some basics out of the way with! I read quite a few reviews from other people who have stayed in Paris stating that the size of the rooms are small. This is a known fact for Paris and therefore I do not think its fair to mark this hotel down for that reason. The same goes for price as anywhere in Paris is expensive compared to UK hotels. Having never been to Paris before, we were keen to chose somewhere which was clean, good value for money, easy to get to and was close to all the main attractions. It was on this basis we chose the Terrass Hotel and it did not dissappoint on any of these fronts. We booked 5 nights here for a standard double room and it cost us £650. In other reviews on this site, we read that requesting an outward view beforehand was a good idea. I decided to do this and e-mailed the hotel directly asking for an outward facing room, with a view of the Eiffell Tower. In less than 24 hours I received a reponse stating that my request had been granted and sure enough when we arrived, our room was as promised. My communication with the staff both via e-mail and face to face was excellent, they were always happy to help and give advice. The room itself was nicely furnished, clean and in a good condition. You could tell that the room had seen better days and had not recently been refurbished but this did not detract from the fact that is was of a good quality. From reading reviews about Paris hotels in general, the Terrass Hotel was no different to any other when it came to the bathroom. Yes, it was small, yes, there was no shower curtain, but what do you expect, it is Paris! The bathroom was spotless and towels, etc were replaced on a daily basis along with the room being cleaned. One word of warning is the size of the bath. I am 5ft 9 ins tall and struggled to move around in the bath as it was very small. Normally I would shower but there was no hook on the wall for the shower head (which again I think tends to be a trend in Paris!). If you are someone that likes your showers and are quite tall, it may be worthwhile checking this out before you book! The location of the hotel was fine. The nearest Metro was about a 10 mins walk away and the airport was about a 25 mins drive. On the subject of the airport, we booked a shuttle in advance to transport us, this cost us just over £50. In hindsight, we probably would've saved money doing this by taxi but the shuttle was very efficient and gave us peace of mind. I would recommend not eating in the hotel restaurant considering the cost as many local restaurants/shops can be found nearby which are cheaper. We visited all sites and had a great time. We would recommend Paris to anyone and do highly rate this hotel. I did see some negative reviews of the Terrass but did not experience anything of this nature in my stay there. I hope this review has been as helpful to others as the reviews already on the site were to us!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in the Terrass Hotel”
Reviews.Author: romalovainzambia
Reviews.Content: Generally, I don't write online hotel reviews, but my stay in the Terrass Hotel moved me to provide my positive feelings about it. The Terrass is located nicely near two metro stations, various restaurants and other ammenities. The room that I stayed in was furnished just as they show in the pictures but was a tad warm (not too sure why). The bathroom and its steam bath was great and could have been the highlight of my stay in Paris had I not traveled to see the various sights of the city! Nonetheless, perhaps what made my stay all the more enjoyable was the fact that the staff was so knowledgeable and helpful in assisting me. Whether it dealt with re-arranging flights or helping me to buy flowers, the staff was great and went out of their way to help. I would definitely stay at the Terrass Hotel when I return to Paris and would recommend it to others, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDavis
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay at the Terrass and thought it was really excellent. We had two interconnecting rooms as we went with our 3 children - the kids' room was enormous, our room not very big but still very comfortable. The bathrooms were also both well appointed and equipped. The concierge was extremely helpful as indeed were all the reception staff. I had the misfortune to break a piece of furniture by accident which was all very embarrassing, but they could not have been more helpful. As we were so exhausted at the end of the first day, we did not want to go out for a meal and just wanted to collapse into bed. We ordered room service, and found the standard to be superb, if a little pricey. One other thing we found useful was the kettle, with tea and coffee sachets which I thought were only provided in English hotels. They were extremely welcome. The location is very good for exploring Montmartre and is very close to Place de Clichy station on the Metro. All in all we had a fantastic if completely exhausting weekend, would definitely stay in the Terrass again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: michaelj2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night (3 of us - parents and daughter) and enjoyed it very much. Very eclectic decoration, but appropriate for the area, good location and excellent and friendly service. I had lunch there and it was excellent. Breakfast was too expensive so we ate at one of the numerous restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: MutleyDog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic, on the edge of Montmartre and a stones throw away from loads of bars, cafes, restaurants etc. We didn’t eat at the hotel as there is so much choice close by for breakfast, lunch and dinner!! We had a junior suite with 2 large rooms and a good size bathroom; the room had very modern décor and was clean and tidy. There was an Iron, mini bar and broadband connection in the room, only 1 English speaking TV channel, but hey, you don’t go to Paris to stay in your hotel room?!? The staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. The hotel is situated on an elevated spot and from our small balcony we had fantastic views across Paris including a great view of the Eiffel Tower. Most of the tourist stuff is a short taxi drive away, but Paris isn’t that big so each ride costs about 7 Euros and there are loads of taxis about. I doubt you could find rooms as good and as big as this anywhere else in Paris without paying an absolute fortune! Paris is cold in March!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: KERW1
Reviews.Content: This is a very attractive hotel. It scores on all fronts (we didn't try the restaurant). Staff are friendly and speak good English and also put up with my dubious French. Housekeeping is very good with spotless, pleasantly decorated rooms. Our classic room was beautifully quiet and had a very good sized bathroom although it did not have a view. All rooms have metal shutters. Location is good if you like the Montmartre area. Suggest a trawl for web rates as the walk in rate is quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little find!”
Reviews.Author: Ratbags
Reviews.Content: The OH and I stayed at the Hotel Terrass for four nights in March and it was wonderful. The hotel was very clean and the standard room was of a good size with a very large and firm bed. The bedroom had a seperate toilet and shower area with two sinks for his and hers! The shower was nice and powerful. There was plenty of storage space and as usual with a desk and comfy chairs. Our room overlooked the courtyard and was lovely and quiet. Each room had metal electric shutters. It was very quiet at night. We decided not to have breakfast at the hotel, and we found a lovely patisserie 100metres up the road from the hotel on the corner which was lovely! Great coffee and pastries! We also decided not to eat at the hotel in the evening and went exploring instead. There are so many lovely little places to sit outside, have a plate of meat of cheese and just watch the world go by! We did have a lovely meal at Soleil Gourmand and found a lovely wine Cave with a little hidden cafe at the back! Would come back and stay at this hotel again. I know a lot of people say that the rooms in Paris are small. I would say that the rooms were of a standards size compared to those that you stay in at most travel hotels. It was clean, spacious, had everything you needed and was a good base! We didn't go to Paris to stay in the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “Alright”
Reviews.Author: jenen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for one night. The room was ok, with a nice view of the city. Staff were friendly, and the place was overall clean and tidy. Not spectacular, but reccommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghTraveler
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat others, but reviewers such as ClareandChris are spot on. We ate at the restaurant twice and I have never received such friendly and professional service. The food was the best we had in Paris and you can choose any 3 courses for 35 euros. The Maitre'd, "Ferrie" was so kind to us, offering suggestions, giving us a tour of the kitchen and even giving us a gift when we left! He was amazing! Also of note was the charming lady behind reception. I don't know her name but she was blond and younger, extremely kind and helpful and spoke impeccable English and German. However, all of the other staff we encountered were fantastic as well. Room/Housekeeping, breakfast, bar ect all top notch also. We got a fantastic deal from e-bookers £530 including 3 nights BB, and direct flights from Edinburgh with Air France. The hotel also gave a free upgrade to a junior suite. Highly recommended! Please e-mail me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClareandChris
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our four night stay at the Terrass very much. The hotel staff were very welcoming, particularly the Consiege who spoke impeccable English and was very helpful, finding us a good restaurant and giving us a written introduction which secured a good table and excellent service on a busy Saturday night. The room was very clean, spacious, and had a good sized bathroom. We would probably select a superior room if we visited again as the view across Paris is wonderful (I went up to the Terrass - which is used as a restaurant in summer - the views are breathtaking and you can pick out all the major sites: Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Des Invalides, etc). Breakfast was a buffet with a useful selection of cheeses, meats, breads, jams and conserves, and of course croissants and pain au chocolat. Freshly squeezed juices and copious amounts of coffee gave us a good start to the day. I would be loath to pay Euro 18 - 20 for this breakfast, and agree with a previous review that you could walk along the street to the Boulangerie and pick up croissants etc for breakfast to eat in your room. There are tea/coffee facilities in the rooms, with a small kettle, mug and sachets of tea and coffee - ask at reception for more cream they have a drawer full! The lasting memory of the Terrass will be the dinner we ate there (our Valentine treat). The food was wonderful - we selected the Euro 35 menu and expected only three courses - but the food kept coming, with dainty choux pastries whilst we were chosing, a delicious pumpkin appetiser, then on to the first course which was a beautifully cooked fresh pasta for me and the foie gras for him. This was followed by an interesting presentation of John Dory in batter in a light almost merange sauce for me and the veal - with a wonderfully light sauce for him. In between courses we we then offered home-made marshmallow and a beautifully presented caramel whilst we selected from the sweet menu. The Trilogy of extra light creme brulee was excellent. We staggered upstairs afterwards and will try to lose the extra pounds later! Total cost with wine was Euro 100 and well worth it too. The chef is excellent and should be congratulated on the presentation and content of all dishes. Nearby are some interesting bistro's - again you can ask for a recommendation from reception or go your own way - walk down to Abbesses and look at the interesting Art Deco Metro, then wander round this area and choose a bistro - we paid around Euro 60 for a wonderful three course meal - no need to pay any more here. La Terrass is very close to buses and the Metro (either Blanche or Place de Clichy - and even Abbesses if you don't want to walk up the hill). Take time to explore the bohemian area of Montmatre, and the nearby cemetery. The hotel is very close to the Moulin Rouge - just down the hill, buy your tickets on line and early (or again ask at reception they just may be able to help you - no guarantees though). All-in-all a very memorable experience, and one that we will certainly repeat - although next time we will use Eurostar rather than fly as the Gare de Nord is so close to the hotel - only a couple of stops away on the Metro. We certainly recommend the Terrass!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful advert for paris”
Reviews.Author: WilliamStafford
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful introduction to Paris. We booked the hotel after browsing through many brochures, but were apprehensive about how things would be. No need to have worried- the hotel was SUPERB. We had booked a 4 night stay to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday and were thrilled with the room and the service from all the staff. Breathtaking views from the terrace and also from the room. Staff were very helpful in explaining about bus and Metro services - would recommend travel by bus - it stops right outside the hotel and goes straight to Louvre and many other sights - very frequent service. Buffet breakfast was found to be quite substanial- after all it is the continent, so why expect a 'fry-up' Faulty sink plug in room was fixed straight away without any problem. Would definitely recommend, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous friendly four star Jim and Moira Graham, Scotland.”
Reviews.Author: Jimgraham
Reviews.Content: After staying 3 nights in a sub-standard London Thistle hotel, the superb Terrass hotel in Paris was a breath of fresh air.It is very pleasant to stay in a hotel which understands the meaning of the word "service". It was a pleasure to come back from an exhausting days sightseeing, to a comfortable, and, justifiably labelled, 4 star hotel. The breakfasts we had in our 3 night stay were good,a nice buffet style layout, with the additional offer of a cooked selection of eggs, bacon,etc. We enjoyed an excellent meal in the hotel restaurant on our final night,very good value at approx. 75 euros for two,excluding wine. Compliments to the chef ! We will definitely be back,and can reccommend the hotel Terrass in Montmartre to all trip advisor members.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: andy_horsham
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a junior suite for a romantic weekend away to propose to my girfriend. The suite was quite modern and a nice size. Bathroom was ok, although one of the taps was broken. The room was the best thing about the hotel .... it was nice. Breakfast was overpriced, £20 euros for Croissants and eggs. I was disappointed with it I must admit. Service at the hotel was fairly awful. The two things that spring to mind were: 1) Booked at the front desk for dinner. Arrived in the restaurant for dinner and no booking at been made. 2) We had been advised by email that we could have a late check out at 3pm. Arrived back at the hotel at 2.30pm to find we had been locked out of the room. the reception staff had the most awful attitude, and I had to go upstairs to prove to get the piece of paper that showed we had been granted a late checkout. i can live with the fact that they made a mistake, however what was worse was a) I knew there was a problem as I queue to complain about being locked out the room, i could could hear the staff talking about me (and it was clear they were moaning!) b) I never got an apology for the mistake they made. Overall, this spoilt what would have been a nice hotel. I would not stay here again, not just because of the service (as I'm sure 99 out of 100 times you'd be ok), but because of the disappointing breakfast, and the lack of professionalism of the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: moriniman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Terrass over New Year in room 505 - superb view over Paris for lights, fireworks (not too many this year) etc. Room spacious, very clean and comfortable and decorated in classic French style. Compact bathroom with good bath and excellent toiletries and towels. Shower a little odd - no screen or way of holding shower over head but good flow and temp control. Staff very helpful and friendly with good advice and dealt promptly with queries. Breakfast very good but a little pricey at 18€ - try to get an inclusive deal - didn't try evening meal as lots of local Montmartre restaurants in a few minutes walk. In summer could be nice to go out and get croissants etc and then use in room coffee facility for breakfast while looking over Paris!! Location superb for Montmartre and it is walkable to Louvre or Champs Elysee (if not wet and your shoes are comfortable!), but bus 80/95 is also a good option or an 8€ taxi fare takes you most places. Metro from Place de la Clichy not too far either and for the adventurous all the attractions of Paris night life (Moulin Rouge etc) are very close by! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kchooloo
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for a business meeting and our first hotel was so bad that we had to leave there. This hotel was heaven! The staff was nice, the room was very clean and newly redone. I would recommend this hotel to my best friend!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Scotsman1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Terrass Hotel for 3 nights, from 4th December for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We originaly honeymoon'd in Paris at a hotel about 500 meters away and wanted to celebrate in the same area (but felt we could afford something better than 25 years ago!). This was our first stay at the Terrass and a definite "find". From check-in to departure the staff were universaly friendly (reception, concierge, bar staff and maids) and only too willing to help. Something one doesn't always find in Parisian Hotels. I had arranged for flowers to be placed in our room in advance of our arrival and given it was our anniversary, the hotel was kind enough to upgrade our deluxe room to a junior suite. This was extremely well presented and comfortable and made the stay. The hotel is modern and well appointed and though some re-furbishment of some rooms on our floor was underway it did not affect us in any way. There is a spacious and welcoming reception area and comfortable lounge and bar. The hotel is situated at the foot of Montmartre and is ideally placed for sightseeing both in the immediate area (Sacre Coer / Abessess) and via Metro links (Place du Clichy / Blanche) I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel and am looking forward to a return visit as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PFandML
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Le Terrass hotel for 4 nights from the 9th until the 13th of November. The hotel was very nice and exactly like the photos...which is rare. The staff were extremely helpful and very pleasant! They followed up with our requests for dinner reservations and tour bookings quickly and efficiently. Our room was lovely. It was a standard room but we requested a room with a view and certainly got it. Our room was on the 6th floor and had 2 small balconies that looked out to the Eiffel Tour. V.romantic! The area is also great with many great restaurants around the corner. We fell lucky that we got to stay in this hotel and can only recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, not dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: newbieParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel during the weekend 6th Oct to 8th. After extensively searching Tripadvisor hotel reviews I liked the look of this hotel. I booked via Eurostar package (the best rate for this hotel). I initially upgraded from a standard room to a superior room and had requested a room with a view, but was told on arrival that the superior rooms were on the courtyard side of the hotel. So if you do want a room with a view be aware of this. However, I was not dissappointed with the room. It was gorgeous, albeit smaller than I had expected from the pictures but still elegant, clean and a little piece of luxury. Our room (double) had a magnificant bathroom that could be accessed from either side of the room with a bath, separate shower and two sinks. Our friends had a twin room on a different floor, again very tastefully decorated, with a corner bath. Both rooms had products, clean towels, hairdryer, iron and ironing board, tea/coffee making facilities (if your English/Irish dont add milk to the tea, its better without, or better still take a couple of teabags with you), lovely little touches all round to make your stay pleasant and comfortable. The staff were excellent and couldnt be more helpful. We needed to get to the other side of Paris for an excursion and as it was a wet friday night we needed a taxi. They fell over themselves trying to get us a taxi, three phones dialling and even had someone in the street trying to hail a taxi. Now thats what I call service. Breakfast! Expensive if not included. We chose to have breakfast on the Sunday as we were returning early, 18 euros, be aware that this price includes cooked eggs (whichever way you want them) it is not very clear that you can order from the waitress and it is included, we helped ourselves to the buffet and ordered scrambled eggs and bacon. My friend had omelette. If you do not want breakfast dont order just tea, 5 euros!! The hotal reception is quite grand and has internet access if your interested in that. The bar is very expensive!!!!!! The location suited us, its not far from the Moulin Rouge or the Sacre Coeur. We loved it as our fist time in Paris, and if you want style/comfort than the Terrass is definately worth the 4 stars. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: craiggsx
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in October 06 after walking out on a 3 star around the corner which was dirty ( Prima Lepic ). I found the staff here very helpful, the hotels a true 4 star, foods good, rooms are excellent and its in a very nice area, Enjoyed our stay, check out the roof garden at night which has excellent views of the tower. Craig Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Silver Wedding Anniversary Stay at the Terrass Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raillink
Reviews.Content: We visited the Terrass as part of our 25th Wedding Anniversary celebrations, and took in two days racing at Longchamp - the Prix De L'Arc de Triomphe Meeting. We took a room on the second floor, which afforded no view. With the benefit of hindsight, and the other reviews on here, perhaps we would have requested a better room. That said, on Arc weekend, our choice may have been more restricted. The room was very clean, and of quite a high standard. We were pleased with the level of accomodation. We booked via 'Hotels Direct' and did so on the basis of board and "full cooked breakfast". The only element of the breakfast that was cooked was the provision of eggs "fried, scrambled or boiled". This information, akin to a state secret, was only elicited after an enquiry of staff, and an observation of others. This was not a problem, and in truth the breakfast fayre was adequate, but "full cooked breakfast" signifies something rather different to those of Irish, English or American origin. Given the number of restaurants and bars in Montmartre/Sacre Couer, the Hotel Restaurant was extremely expensive, and we did not use it during our stay. We did stray into the bar on one evening only, but a cognac and a gin and tonic at a total cost of 21 Euros was enough to persuade us that better value was to be had elsewhere. The minibar in the room looked tempting enough, but considering that a 3 cl bottle of cognac would have cost us 7 Euro, as opposed to a 20 cl bottle (same brand) for Euro 4.50 at a shop directly over the road, this was not a facility we used either. Thestaff were unfailingly polite, and room cleaning was excellent, but on checkout, the receptionist did attempt to charge us for minibar items. The quickness of withdrawal when we challenged this smacked of a "try on", but this was a minor issue. All in all, the Terrass was worthy of it's 4 star rating, but we would shop around (and perhaps demand more) if staying in that sector of Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Dim!!”
Reviews.Author: FIRESTONE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from 11 September, and booked via Eurostar. A taxi from Gare de Nord cost around 7 euros, which was very reasonable. The coolness of the reception staff was made up for by the various concierge staff that we met, and whom we found to be extremely helpful. On arrival we were warned that breakfast is not included but could be booked for 18 Euros each, and so we ate at a variety of small cafes a few yards down the road -average cost 8 Euros. The hotel is well appointed and in good order throughout, though the room that we were allocated (201) has no view to speak of (see photo); the window looked out onto a deep "well" area, with a postage stamp sized view of the sky. One of us had to nip down to the main entrance to judge what the weather was each morning so we could dress accordingly. However the room was clean, and quiet; the bathroom small but adequate. The bar was fairly pricey, but pleasant, and pianist makes an appearance on certain evenings. We never ate in the restaurant, but this looked nice - but again, quite expensive. If haggling is your "bag" then press for a higher room - with a view - if you're allocated any dark, inward facing rooms. Being located in Montmartre the main attractions seem a bit distant but this was compensated by the "village" feel to the Montmartre locale...lots of nice small shops and eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Terrass”
