Reviews.Author: Blackstone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent two nights at this hotel for our wedding anniversary. We had a basic room, but it was tastefully decorated, had a large, comfortable bed and great roomy bathroom. There was no view as it faced onto an inner courtyard, but this made it very quiet. The whole of the hotel was spotless and very well maintained. We decided not to eat or drink in the hotel, preferring the atmosphere of the bars and restaurants in adjoining Montmartre. The location of the hotel is terrific and, although quite expensive, we would thoroughly recommend it for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Graceloves
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room at this hotel with airmiles and our friends booked a junior suite. Our room was on the fifth floor and had a wonderful view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower. However, I was a bit disappointed with it, the decor was predominately red and could have been any airport hotel and the bathroom was very small and you had to stand in the bath to turn the taps on. The hotel is on a busy corner and I did think it might be noisy but I didn't hear traffic noise at night only the noise of the TV in the next bedroom. Our friends had a much nicer room but they had paid a lot more for it. Our deal included breakfast which was nice. We ate on the top floor terrace one night and it was quite good and a fantastic view but again very expensive for simple French food which you could get for half the price down the road at any local restaurant. The service was excellent and they went to great trouble for us.

Reviews.Title: “Sour taste - Nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jclayton9
Reviews.Content: There are many good sides to this hotel that must be mentioned first and foremost. 1) The rooms are a great size for Paris. We stayed in a deluxe room which was great. Huge bathroom, and a REAL king size bed. 2) The concierge was amazing! She recommended an amazing restaurant after calling a number of others for us that had happened to be (luckily) booked solid for the night. This restaurant was one of the highlights of our European trip, and made an amazing last night. 3) The view! 4) Location is great if you want to be in Montmarte. Personally, we liked the location of our other hotel much better (Hotel de Varenne, in the 7th) My only complaint is that this hotel is extremely over priced. Not only are the rooms extremely expensive (even in the off season), but it seems that at every corner they’re trying to gouge you for money. Every other hotel that we stayed at in Europe had included breakfast. In the room there was a door hanger for ordering breakfast. It allowed you to select coffee of tea, Orange or grapefruit juice, etc. Then there was a section below that included other breakfast options, with prices that you could pay for to include in your breakfast. Since the prices were high, we just stayed with the continental breakfast: Two coffees, Two orange juices, and a couple of small croissants. Upon checkout, the lady informed me that this breakfast was 18E each! 40E for a continental breakfast! That’s like $60 Canadian…wow…that’s what I mean by ‘sour taste’. When I brought up the fact that the menu made it seam that it was included, she said “oh….that’s too bad that you didn’t know”. I guess it’s my own fault, but for the price of this room, you would think they would include a coffee and a croissant, not charge you a fortune for it. Oh well, I was too tired to make a big deal about it. (By the way, the coffee sucked).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: 2Adults2Kids
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at this hotel at least 15 times on business and think it is one of the nicest hotels in its price range in Paris. It is located in at the non-touristy end of Montmartre, about a 10 min walk from the Metros at Abbesses and Clichy. The area has a great village feel. The hotel has recently been refurbished, all the rooms are individually designed but with a general theme, which tends to be a bit chintzy. The arrangement of the bathrooms in some rooms can be idiosyncratic, but again clean modern and characterful. The new restaurant is great and during the summer you can also eat on the open terrace on the top floor, which has fabulous views over Paris. The hotel has a range of rooms, which do vary greatly in size, the ones at the front are very large and have the great view of Paris, the ones at the back can be quite small (although not unusually so) and look over the rooftops of Montmartre. I think this view has just as much character, but I can see how you could be disappointed if you were expecting the panoramic view, so I’d ask to see the room first. Strangely the prices don’t seem to reflect the size of room. We have also stayed there as a family, and the suites are great; they have siding doors dividing them into a bedroom and living room. The hotel will put two beds in the living room giving two interconnected rooms, both of which have access to the suite’s bathroom and toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bullitpromotions
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of the Hotel Terrass on trip adviser i decided to try it out for my girlfriends christmas present and our stay was absolutely fantastic. We stayed in one of the Deluxe Superior rooms and it was brilliant, the bathroom had a steam shower which was great after a days site seeing and then a long night of alcohol. We definitely felt well looked after, Danielle on reception sorted us Moulin Rouge tickets for that night with only 5 hours noticed and we were given great recomendations on what to do. The restaurant attached to the hotel was really great as well. The hotel could not be faulted on any level, if your staying in one of the deluxe superiors you will not be dissapointed. While in Paris if your looking for a bar you must go to Budha Bar, pricy but well worth it the most uber cool place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Voyageur
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome at this well-located Montmartre hotel. From reception to check-out, we had hardly a complaint, and those we had were very minor: an easily fixed loose shower head and no "Do Not Disturb" sign. The room was decent sized for a Paris hotel, with a very accommodating tiled dual-sink bathroom. Two single beds pushed together formed our "double." If you want a true double, you need to be specific. Although the lobby bar is pricy --- cocktails 10 euros, wine less --- its fireplace was a real comfort on cold December nights. Breakfast was included in our package and was a typical European buffet, with everything from cereals and bread to cold cuts and cheese. They will also very good cook eggs and bacon for you. Our one dinner at the sidewalk-level restaurant was delicious. (The rooftop restaurant with its panoramic views was closed --- cold December nights, and all that.) The staff ---like most of the people we met in Paris --- are doing their absolute best to dispel the myth of the haughty French. Most speak acceptable English; a few spoke as well as I do. The hotel is convenient to Place de Clichy, with two Metro lines and more bus lines than I could count. Rue Lepic is a block away, with its excellent food shops. Within walking distance, we ate at the very good Melrose on Place de Clichy and the excellent Poulbot Gourmet on Rue Lemarck.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gryphon_abroad
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our 5 year anniversary weekend and wasn't disappointed. We chose this hotel for the reviews on this site and were very happy. Our room was 404 and it was massive and had a view of the Eiffel tower from our bed. I think that the room was a suite and was huge by any standard although a little tired and probably one of the rooms that hasn't had the refurbishment as yet. It did have a massive bathroom with great shower pressure something you don't get here in London and I miss from home in Australia. The staff were always helpful and the breakfast was very good although they seemed to be a little run off their feet on the Sunday morning. The view from the 7th floor where they serve food in the warmer months is awesome and we will definately return at some stage to eat out up there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff were superb, very helpful + friendly. On our first night we were allocated a "superior" room which we weren’t really satisfied with. Basically some of the rooms have been refurbished and are very contemporary whilst the older ones were a little drab (IMO). We asked if we could be moved into one of the refurbished ones and for the second night we had a stunning room with steam shower + flat panel TV. Location in great, breakfast is good and overall a superb hotel, but I would definitely suggest booking on of the refurbished rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a perfect few days staying at the Hotel Terrass. Great location - walked to all the major sights though would have been easy to get in the Metro. Only 20 mins max from Gare du Nord. Very close to Moulin Rouge in a lively street. (Hotel very quiet) Beautifully appointed rooms. Great staff - genuinely friendly and happy to help. Great breakfast. The showpiece has to be the restaurant on the roof - superb views of Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides and Montparnasse. Excellent food - price very good compared to London especially with view and great service thrown in! Will certainly be looking this place up first when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small standard rooms, excellent service. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Chriswith2kidsandawife
Reviews.Content: The title says it all - the rooms are clean and modern, but quite small. We did see the "superior" rooms and they are a more comfortable size. The bathroom is so small that there is not room for a proper shower - you have to hold the shower head whilst trying not to spray water all over the floor! We had an excellent view, over the cemetery towards the Eiffel tower. The hotel is just on the edge of Montmartre - 5 minutes from the Moulin Rouge and a breathless 15 minute walk to the Sacre Coeur. Within easy walking distance of 3 metro stations the whole of Paris is only one or 2 short journeys away. The service was excellent and I would have no qualms in recommending this hotel. Having stayed in Paris a number of times before, I would also not hesitate in returning to this hotel. Incidentally, we could not get tickets from the Moulin Rouge but the concierge managed to get us some from a "friend" who worked there!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family spent 4 lovely days in Paris and what made it extra special was the hotel. My 7 year old couldn't get enough of the juicy bacon for breakfast and I loved the fresh bread. We definitely look forward to going to France again and staying at the Terass Hotel!
